results.description:
Every week we will have a different prompt for our weekly photo project.  This week’s theme is A need for speed

Each week beginning early Monday morning, you can begin uploading your photos to our meetup album for the week’s theme.  The group won’t actually meet for this event, it’s an individual online challenge for each of you to get your creative juices flowing, share photos in the group, comment and critique each other’s shots, and above all have fun. 

Albums will remain open, so you can upload photos any time after that Monday morning start time but you’ll get the most feedback during the initial week the theme is posted.  You also don’t have to restrict yourself to photos taken during that week for the theme, they can be from past shoots you have done or the weekly prompt can be used to motivate you to shoot something new.

Please consider sharing your project photos with our other chapters on our Facebook group.
results.name: Weekly Photo Project - A need for speed

results.description:
10-12 miles of mostly mellow paddling thorough through the forests, farmlands and quaint towns of Litchfield County, CT--in their Spring finest! The fast, flat water, means we move with minimal effort--plenty of time to fish, soak in the sun and look for birds, turtles & other wildlife. There are a few stretches of whitewater that will get the heart pumping, especially in the days following spring rains; exciting enough to please the thrill seekers but manageable for everyone--especially with a rack team of river rat guides supporting you!

We’ll enjoy an especially luxurious riverbank lunch--with the river carrying our gear, we can pack heavy! After taking out our canoes in Housatonic Meadows State Park in the late afternoon, we’ll have time to explore the quaint, historic town of Kent, CT before heading back to NYC Moderate, Canoes

In normal conditions, this adventure is rated--Moderate

Paddle Adventures include: Transportation to/from NYC, convenient pick-ups in Brooklyn and Manhattan. A Breakfast on our ride to the mountains and Gourmet Lunch, served--and carried--by your guides. Dietary custom & allergies? No problem--just let us know! Canoes, All Paddling Gear & Instruction; an orientation for first timers--a refresher for the veterans...

Enter Custom Code MUP35 at checkout for Member Pricing--35% OFF!!
results.name: Housatonic River Canoeing Trip!

results.description:
Time for another Palisades trail run! This run will start at the bus station, go over the bridge, up the Palisades Long Path and back.

I'll be running at a 10-11 minute/mile pace and aiming for the Park Headquarters (19 miles round-trip from the bus station). Every pace and distance is welcome, but if you can't find someone who matches yours, be prepared to run on your own. Other notable turn-around points include the State Line Cafe (25 miles round-trip), Alpine Lookout (16 miles round-trip), Greenbrook Sanctuary (13 miles round-trip), and the Rockefeller Lookout (10 miles round-trip).

Note that if you turn around before the Park Headquarters, you might be looking at up to 13 miles between water sources. Please plan your hydration accordingly!

If you would like to meet up with us on the New Jersey side, find us at the trail start just over the pedestrian bridge around 8:50 am. Please indicate this in your RSVP. 

During this event, you will have a rare opportunity to view the world's largest free-flying American flag, which hangs from the George Washington Bridge on select holidays.


Useful wayfinding information:

• Here’s a map of the trail. The Long Path is marked “A” on the map and is marked with aqua blazes. Please familiarize yourself with the trail map before coming to the run.


• Here's a list of landmarks along with their distance from the bus station.

• I’ve also made a Google Map that shows the trail along with several points of interest, including restrooms and places to get water. This map is approximate - do not rely on it for navigation!

As always, please view the group's About page and make sure you understand your responsibilities as an event participant.
results.how_to_find_us: The George Washington Bridge Bus Terminal is closed for construction. We will meet at the trailer on Ft. Washington Ave. that is serving as the temporary bus station.
results.name: Memorial Day Palisades Long Path Trail Run

Some of you requested we set up a meetup for Memorial Day on 5/30. I'm going to let you all decide if we play on Sunday 5/29 or Monday 5/30. Please make a comment as to what date you prefer. If we get enough people to play then we'll play on the day where we can get the most people. If not then there will not be any games this week.

The following week on 6/5 will be Eric's last day with us before he migrates South. If you can please show up so we can haze him and do a group picture. Figured it would have sentimental value to an old guy... =P

Thanks!!

***************

 
Attendance will be strictly enforced. No-shows will be marked and posted on the subsequent meetup. First time offenders will be given the benefit of doubt, second time offenders will be warned (consider your name in this email and the number of times you no-showed as warning) and those who miss a third time will be banned,permanently! Those that show up without RSVP to circumvent this will be warned as well. results.description:
16 miles brisk pace. Complete the first four legs of Cy A Adler’s Battery to Bear Mountain, a series that we may continue on July 4th.  Walking along the west side at a brisk pace with numerous brief stops at sites and restrooms along the way, including Battery Park and Greenway, Irish Hunger Memorial, The High Line Elevated Park, Grant’s Tomb, The Little Red Lighthouse. 

We will walk over the George Washington Bridge and not quit until we reach Starbucks / 7 – 11 in Fort Lee. This will be a one-way hike! There is a bus / jitney that will take us back to Manhattan to a convenient train station. Bring lunch !!! We will stop at along the way for snacks and be at Fairway around 2:15 for lunch. Hike should end around 5 p.m. 

Heavy rain may cancel.  Contact Leader for questions or concerns.  Registration desired, not required. No email day of hike. Please email if you are coming and check your email by 7am to verify hike is on, in case of an emergency. You can expect a large, sociable crowd that you and your feet will not forget. This hike will run jointly with Meetup Shorewalkers and AMC.


Meeting:  Leaving from the front of the Staten Island Ferry Terminal in Manhattan, arrive at 9:30 so we may start on time, at 9:45 a.m.

Leader: Irv Reich [masked] [masked]

Contact hike leader directly if you have questions about the hike.

Free for Shorewalkers members who have paid the $20 annual membership fee, $3 for non-members. Non-members please pay the hike leader at the beginning of the hike or visit www.shorewalkers.org to join.

https://s.evbuc.com/https_proxy?url=http%3A%2F%2Fphotos4.meetupstatic.com%2Fphotos%2Fevent%2F9%2F1%2F0%2F7%2F600_438217127.jpeg&sig=ADR2i7_YYSbYGdARkiNS8cboObnv7IawXQ

Founded in 2003, K1 Speed is the premier karting company in America. With kart racing centers nationwide, K1 Speed brings the thrill and excitement of indoor karting to a large audience. Offering highly-advanced and environmentally-friendly electric go karts as well as large indoor entertainment venues that feature authentic racing memorabilia, pit cafes, meeting rooms and pool tables, K1 Speed is a great place to visit with family and friends or to host a corporate event or party.

When it comes to go-kart racing in Poughkeepsie, there is no better option than K1 Speed! Our indoor karting center – like each and every one of our centers nationwide – is designed to be a world-class entertainment venue. If you are accustomed to go-kart tracks located on the outskirts of town in abandoned fields, you are in for a surprise! Our indoor karting center features a professionally designed race track, high-performance electric karts, and a museum collection of authentic racing memorabilia. Take everything that you think you know about karting and throw it out – we’re here to redefine your expectations!   To experience indoor karting yourself, visit K1 Speed Poughkeepsie today. Our go-kart racing is second to none, and we can assure you that you will not be disappointed! We look forward to seeing you in our center soon.*

After the races, we will have lunch at a local restaurant.

Return: Expect to be back in Midtown West at 5:30 PM and Union Square at 6:00 PM

• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED (for both real grass and artificial grass)! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: WE DON'T HAVE A PERMIT, BUT FIELD IS USUALLY UNOCCUPIED AT THIS TIME

• BRING A WHITE SHIRT AND A DARK SHIRT

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- JJ)

(Co-Leader- Ray Ray)

• PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY TO START ON TIME !! Game starts when we have at least 10 players.

Rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

• Minimum 10 RSVPs needed for game. Games will be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is canceled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change.

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

Welcome to all new members, thanks for joining this group on a whim! Your decision is about to be rewarded with pizza.

We're going to have a launch party in June-early July, so this is like the pre-pre-launch planning party! This will be a non-technical meet-and-greet, no presentation or code project.

I'd love to know what everyone's background is, what sort of events you would like to see happen with Team Pizza. If you have personal projects, or would like to mentor / get mentorship as you build something, you'll have a chance to pitch to the group at the event!

We are broadly inclusive & beginner friendly, so whether you're a techie of some sort, or you're simply curious and have no idea whether learning to code is for you, please come!

See you monday!
-Olex & Tati

results.description: Often considered one of the first examples of Italian neorealism, Luchino Visconti's first film was this adaptation of James M. Cain's steamy novel The Postman Always Rings Twice, which would also be made twice in the U.S., first in 1946 with Lana Turner and John Garfield and then in 1981 with Jack Nicholson and Jessica Lange. Massimo Girotti stars as a drifter named Gino, who gets a job at a provincial inn. The handsome wanderer attempts to resist the advances of Giovanna (Clara Calamai), the estranged wife of nasty innkeeper Bragana (Juan de Landa), but he eventually gives in. Gino then allows her to talk him into killing Bragana to get the insurance money, with predictable results. Although the melodramatic story is a far cry from the post-war social statements of such later neorealist classics as Roberto Rossellini's Rome, Open City (1945) and Vittorio De Sica's Bicycle Thieves (1948), the movie began to feature some of neorealism's defining characteristics: above all, an emphasis on outdoor shooting and natural light and a relentless focus on the lives of the poor.Ossessione caused a sensation not just because of its lurid subject matter but also becauseVisconti's realist style makes you practically feel the heat and dirt and sweat of the film's environment.

results.description: QiGong, (Chi Kung) and Tai Chi Chuan both involves the study of energy cultivation, movement and control of our body, mind and spirit energies. They are traditional Chinese arts, practiced for health, revitalization and self defense. It requires no equipment and can be learned and practiced by both young and old. Since it is a gentle exercise it is suitable for people in a wide range of physical conditions. The movements are adjustable to fit the health and strength levels of each individual. The Tai Chi form is performed slowly and continuously, taking about ten minutes to complete.

Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 4:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

<a href="http://www.meetup.com/BklynPickupSoccer/members/9532579"></a>
results.how_to_find_us: Meet on field 8 / Look for people wearing orange or blue pinnies.
results.name: Monday Pick-up 4 PM

results.description:
Joan Crawford won an Academy Award for her bravura portrayal of the titular heroine in Mildred Pierce. The original James M. Cain novel concerns a wife and mother who works her way to financial security to provide a rosy future for her beloved daughter, but encounters difficulties and tragedies along the way. Ranald McDougall's screenplay tones down the sexual content, enhancing its film noir value by adding a sordid murder. The film opens with oily lounge lizard Monte Beragon (Zachary Scott) being pumped full of bullets. Croaking out the name "Mildred", he collapses and dies. Both the police and the audience are led to believe that the murderer is chain-restaurant entrepreneur Mildred Pierce (Crawford), who takes the time to relate some of her sordid history. As the flashback begins, we see Mildred unhappily married to philandering Bert Pierce (Bruce Bennett). She divorces him, keeping custody of her two beloved daughters, Veda (Ann Blyth) and Kay (Jo Anne Marlowe). To keep oldest daughter Veda in comparative luxury, Mildred ends up taking a waitressing position at a local restaurant. With the help of slimy real estate agent Wally Fay (Jack Carson), she eventually buys her own establishment, which grows into a chain of restaurants throughout Southern California. Meanwhile, Mildred smothers Veda in affection and creature comforts. She goes so far as to enter into a loveless marriage with the wealthy Monty Beragon in order to improve her social standing; Beragon repays the favor by living the life of a layabout playboy, much to Mildred's dismay -- and possible financial ruin.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KoOr_OoHbv4

results.description:
How do we, as Christians, use social media like Facebook and Twitter. Are we presenting ourselves like Jesus would or maybe not all the time.

We will discuss how social media impacts our lives and especially our faith.


What can we as Christian do to be more Christlike on social media and what does it take to help and pray for someone on the internet. Do we keep each other accountable and do we respond the same way as we would in person.


There are so many questions we can ask on this topic, I look forward in having a great discussion.
results.name: Faith and Social Media

results.description:
Since Mondays/Wendesdays in the Spring and Summer tend to be the most popular times. I am going to put in a few new  ground rules, so by RSVP-ing "yes" you hereby state you have read the following stipulations and will abide by them. We are setting the RSVP limit to 24 but do not be disheartened to join the "wait-list".  Those who RSVP "yes" are given a definite spot in the game if they arrive before or EXACTLY at 5:30. If you have been "wait-listed" please check a hour before the meet up time to see if you were bumped up to "RSVP Yes" but don't be afraid to show up either, there is no guarantee but there are also last minute drop outs. For those who do not RSVP and just show up, you must wait until 6pm and depending upon the order you showed up in and if the conditions mentioned above are not met, you will be allowed to play to make it so the teams are 12 each. If you have RSVP-ed and do not show up by the time we kick off and teams are full, you will be put aside.  If you don't show up at all and RSVP-ed "yes", you will be warned 3 times and after that every time I see your name on RSVP you will be put as a "no". I know this is an issue for some of you but please understand in all fairness we don't want a game of 14 v 14,  and we have to be accountable when there is such a high demand to play. Also there is NO SLIDE TACKLING what so ever allowed

 If you have any gripes about this please message me and we can talk but in all likely-hood I will not make an exception.
results.name: Soccer meetup

results.description:
45 minutes of diving into the teachings, techniques, and practice of Meditation, for new and experienced Meditators.

All meditations are meant to purify our heart and bring our mind to its natural condition. Our consciousness is inherently pure, eternal, full of knowledge and bliss. But somehow or other it has been covered by and adulterated by so many misconceptions, so many desires, so many longings, so many anxieties about what we want and what we don’t want. 

When you look into a mirror, you see yourself. But what if that mirror has been neglected for hundreds of years? There are layers and layers of debris, dust, dirt and filth. And when you look into that mirror, all you see is the dust and the dirt that is accumulated, and all that you think is “This is me!” But when you clean the mirror, little by little you start seeing the image of yourself. And when the mirror is actually clean, you see who you are. Meditation is for that purpose; prayers are for that purpose; spirituality is for that purpose: to cleanse our heart, to cleanse our life-style so that we can actually directly experience our own essence, which is eternal, full of knowledge and full of love
results.name: Let's meet up and Meditate

group.name: Meditation & Kirtan: For New and Experienced - LES/E.Village

results.description:
Come experience the holistic healing modality of Core Energetics!

Please note that this Meetup is only open to those who have not attended before as space is limited. We will start on time and there will be no entry after 6:05pm, so please arrive early.

Core Energetics is a body-oriented psychotherapy that works with a person's emotional blocks, often held in the body. Life can be more joyful when old pain is released through energetic movement. We bring consciousness to old patterns to free ourselves and make lasting changes. 

Focusing on a holistic process involving body, emotion, mind and spirit, Core Energetics is a mode of healing that combines bodywork, psychotherapy and spiritual process. Core Energetics is applicable to many problems people face such as depression, anxiety, low self esteem, addiction, childhood and adult trauma, general dissatisfaction or a search for more meaning in their life. This method also works with stress management and chronic physical problems, including sexual dysfunction. 

A typical session consists of a combination of traditional talk therapy to bring consciousness and awareness to issues as well as various body movements to activate held energy in the body. 

Dr. John Pierrakos founded Core Energetics in 1978 and most forms of body psychotherapy and transpersonal work in the United States are informed by his work.
results.name: Introduction to Core Energetics (Body-Oriented Psychotherapy)

results.description:
Please note that our group and our happy hours are not for non-Asians. 


We are continuing the tenth round of our icebreaker game. Since most of you are now accustomed to how the games work, we are going to ask old and new members to dig deeper and answer more personal questions to get to know one another better.  Last month, the questions were more specific and personal so we allowed matches with inexact answers.  This month, we have more questions on interest and preference and therefore the answers have to be an exact match.  

As before, the game will start at 6:30 pm and will run until 7:30 pm. The first 25 matches will get a free drink ticket each! Here are the rules: 

1. Find a person with the same magical question printed on the rules card in bold. 

2. Find out if your match has your same magical answer. 

After completing 1 and 2 above, find one of the organizers (Richard Young or Tiffany Ma) to get your free drinks (available only for the first 25 matches – so come on time!).

--

Our monthly happy hour is our flagship event that started it all years ago in 2005. Experience what it's all about -- come and meet fellow Asian professionals in a friendly, casual atmosphere. Relax after work and meet some new people.

Because this is a free event where you are not paying a cover or door fee, we humbly request that you please buy one drink or more to support our venue since they are turning away other business to allow us to host our event (buying alcoholic drinks/soft drinks/bottled water helps support the venue -- getting free tap/iced water does not).

First time to one of our events?  See photos from previous happy hours on Meetup or Facebook.

Hope to see you there!

Also find us on Facebook:
https://www.facebook.com/events/1101464689913585/
results.name: May 2016 NYAPM Happy Hour

Core Energetics is applicable to many problems people face such as depression, anxiety, low self esteem, addiction, childhood and adult trauma, general dissatisfaction or a search for more meaning in their life. This method also works with stress management and chronic physical problems, including sexual dysfunction. A typical session consists of a combination of traditional talk therapy to bring consciousness and awareness to issues as well as various body movements to activate held energy in the body. Dr. John Pierrakos founded Core Energetics in 1978 and most forms of body psychotherapy and transpersonal work in the United States are informed by his work.
results.name: Introduction to Core Energetics (Body-Oriented Psychotherapy)

results.description:
This time we'll be having Vietnamese food at Saigon Market, on University Place just south of 12th St.  They do separate checks.  A menu is here.  Entrees with meat start at about $17.

A $5 *DEPOSIT* via Paypal or credit card is required to RSVP, which will be *REFUNDED* *IN* *CASH* 10 minutes after the event starts.  No-shows and latecomers forfeit their deposit.  If you change your RSVP more than 24 hours before the event, your deposit will be refunded electronically.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

Reagan took office during a mild recession, while Obama took office in the middle of a financial catastrophe with the economy in a radical tailspin.

The 1980 federal deficit, Carter's last, was 2.6% of GDP.  The 1988 deficit, Reagan's last, was 3.7% of GDP, a 42% increase.  The 2008 deficit, Bush's last, was 4.4% of GDP, while, the 2016 deficit, Obama's last, is projected to be 3.4% of GDP, a 22% reduction.

The peak unemployment rate under Reagan was 10.8%.  The peak unemployment rate under Obama was 9.9%.

The biggest scandal of Obama's presidency was that the Obamacare promise of "if you like your health plan, you can keep it" was broken.  Reagan, however, waged war against the Sandanistas without congressional approval, and shipped arms to the Iranians, our bitterest enemies in the world.


Hardly anybody seems to appreciate that, during Obama's presidency, we were rescued from the precipice.  Many people are very unhappy, with a substantial fraction of both parties voting for angry, extremist candidates; Reagan, on the other hand, was considered an exceptionally successful president, with the election of 1988 that followed him being between two reasonably moderate candidates.  Even the Jesse Jackson campaign of 1988, which was fairly radical, was based more on hope than anger.


Why do so few people appreciate Obama's accomplishments?

Reagan's popularity is all the more remarkable in that the right wing media wasn't very developed yet.  Fox News didn't start until 8 years after he left office.

Part of the problem may be that we are currently at the end of about 30 years of stagnation of median wages, which is hardly Obama's fault, and that has people upset.  There has been radical inflation of real estate and college tuition prices over the years, meaning that the average person has to take on crushing levels of debt compared to during the Reagan era.

Obama's biggest failing has been his management of the media.  At least 80% of the population still thinks the 2008 financial rescue was a gift, rather than a loan which has long since been paid back with a profit for the government, and that results in outrage across the political spectrum.


The media has changed completely since the eighties.  Back then, cable and satellite TV weren't well developed, with the dominant media coming from moderate liberal sources.

Another factor is that social media didn't exist during the Reagan years.  Most political debate was in person, which tends to be a lot more civil than what occurs on the Internet.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------

A couple of books have come out about the fact that single women are much happier than they used to be, and much more selective about who they marry, rather than settling for the first offer they get.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------

The technology doesn't exist to store electricity cheaply enough for solar and wind to bear the brunt of most electricity production.  There are almost no suitable places to expand hydroelectric capacity above what it is now, and geothermal is only viable in a few places.  In that context, if we are to reduce carbon emissions while producing electricity, nuclear energy is looking better and better.

Even taking the cancer deaths projected to be caused by Chernobyl and Fukushima Daiichi into account, nuclear is still safer than coal: it has been projected that if all the nuclear electric power stations in the US were replaced by coal-fired plants, it would result in thousands more deaths annually from illness caused by the increased coal pollution.


Nuclear waste disposal is still a problem, but we have a suitable repository available at Yucca Mountain in Nevada; the main obstacles there are political rather than technical.

If we develop thorium-based nuclear energy, it will be much harder for anyone to turn the fuel into bombs, and it will produce about 1% as much waste as conventional uranium-based power.


In the meantime, Greenpeace drones on about the dangers of nuclear energy while pushing technologically unrealistic alternatives, something I've been hearing for at least 40 years.
results.how_to_find_us: I'll have a sign on the table, and I look like my picture.
results.name: Vietnamese Food: Obama vs Reagan, Happy Single Women, Nuclear Energy

Game description:

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field!

VERY IMPORTANT:

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


“Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play.

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous.

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game.


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board, 10 PM the night before to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

West End Presbyterian Church

165 West 105th Street, New York, NY

Near the lines: 1, 2, 3, B, and C trains.

Call me if you can’t find us - (917)[masked] Manny S.

A positive attitude, pair of sneakers or INDOOR shoes (ONLY), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee:
You will be asked to pay $9.25 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.25 dollars is used to pay for: permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, Goals, soccer balls etc.

* The Meetup is cancelled

We expect everyone to respect the facilities and act accordingly.

results.description:
Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

results.description:
• Awaken your body and mind’s innate healing powers
• Develop healthier and more fulfilling relationships
• Learn to work constructively with your own emotions
• Stimulate your minds innate problem solving capabilities
• Develop new resources and capabilities
• Become clear about your life’s purpose
Develop your intuition by tapping into the innate intelligence that resides within your body and mind
Our bodies communicate with us all the time. Many of us are so over stimulated and stressed out that we cannot hear what our bodies are saying. We age faster and suffer many health problems when we do not know how to listen to what our body is telling us.
Discover the amazing wisdom that resides within your own body. Ben will show you how to develop your sensory awareness. Learn to truly listen to your body and care for its needs.
Stimulate the mind's creative problem solving capabilities by learning to "digest" issues, emotions and stresses
Many of us have never learned how to work with difficult issues and emotions. We tend to push these things down inside of ourselves. Undigested thoughts, issues, emotions and the stresses of daily life create a residue that accumulates within the tissues and organs of our bodies. That creates a great deal of additional stress upon our body and mind. These stresses can arrest our process of development, disconnect us from the divine creative intelligence of the universe and shut down our intuition. It also causes our bodies break down at a more rapid pace and that accelerates the aging process.

Learn to use your body-mind's innate healing power to "digest and assimilate" your thoughts feelings, emotions, issues and life experiences. You will begin to release the stresses that are held within the body and to heal the painful emotions associated with anxiety, depression and emotionally traumatic experiences. You will also learn to go right to the source of the issues to bring about a resolution that allows you to really move forward in your life.
Working with these practices helps to increase your intellectual and emotional range, improve memory, initiate new cycles of growth, awaken inner passions, spark creativity and deepen intuition. You will develop the strength and resilience that will make it easier for you to adapt to the demands that life places upon you.
Discover the passion and power that resides within you
Chinese Martial Arts Masters emphasize the development of a base of power known as the "dan tien". The stress of living in such a fast paced world can cause us to disconnect from our foundation. Undigested food, emotions and the stresses of daily life begin to accumulate within the abdomen. We may experience bloating and suffer from various digestive problems. Some of us begin to lose touch with our drive, passion, inspiration and the sense of knowing that reveals our true purpose as our instinctual base shuts down.

You will learn to become fully present within your body, to develop greater personal power, and to awaken the inner passion and sense of knowing that will bring give you a greater sense of clarity about your life's purpose.

Activate the healing intelligence that resides within the body and mind
We all have a powerful healing intelligence that resides within our bodies and minds. This innate healing power helps to mend our bodies any time we suffer an illness or injury. Our innate healing powers are often compromised by the stress and toxins that accumulate within our bodies.
Learn to activate the generative healing powers that reside within your own body and mind. Awaken the consciousness of the individual organs. Access and heal the emotions and core issues that are held within the body. These practices are very effective for healing digestive and respiratory disorders and a wide range of other health issues.


Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.

Please go to http://www.doiohm.com... or call (913)[masked] for more information

I'm working out in the field much of the time and I have very limited access to the internet. Please call me at (913)[masked] if you have any questions and are interested in attending. I will be happy to answer any questions that you have about how you can awaken the healing powers that reside within your own body and mind. Let me know in advance about your individual needs and concerns and we will address these issues during class.

Please only YES RSVP if you are coming to the group

Sign up for my free monthly internet journal at http://www.doiohm.com...
results.name: Awaken the Healing Power Within Your Body and Mind

group.name: Awaken the Healing Power Within Your Body  and Mind

results.description:
• Heal the emotional wounds of past relationships
• Transform deep seated patterns of abandonment and rejection
• Let go of unhealthy dysfunctional relationships
• Develop the ability to remain centered in the core of your being
• Become truly loving and accepting of yourself
• Develop a warm magnetic presence that will draw others to you
• Cultivate inner beauty
• Increase your capacity to give and receive love
• Attract a healthy and loving partner
• Create healthier and more fulfilling relationships
• Develop a stronger connection with the higher power
• Learn to evolve spiritually through your relationships


My friend Sema was telling me about how she had fallen for a man, but he had not called her in some time. Sema told me that she felt this man would come back to her somewhere down the road. Yet she also acknowledged that on another level she was experiencing a fear of loss and that she didn’t feel that there was much hope for the relationship. Sema told me later that evening that she could never seem to hold onto the men that she truly wanted to be with.

Sema was obviously strung out on the man, but she was very disconnected from the underlying pain that was driving her. Sema’s head was just spinning in circles as she analyzed everything the man said or did and why he wasn’t with her at that time. I could see that the hurt buried within Sema was keeping her attached to the man in a very unhealthy way…

Does this sound familiar?

Many of us are struggling to find love. But no matter what we do, love always seems to evade us.

I’ve been there myself and I didn’t know if I would ever find the love that I desired. But I persevered because I was very determined to heal and have someone special in my life. I discovered a series of practices that have enabled me to heal the emotional wounds and to develop a magnetic presence. These practices are making it possible for me to attract more loving partners and to create healthier and more fulfilling relationships. I have now decided to share these practices and understandings so that others can also create more love and intimacy and to attract someone truly special.

Open Your Heart by Healing the Emotional Wounds That Carry Over From Childhood and Past Loves
Most of us are still carrying the emotional wounds from our childhood and our past loves. We try to block the hurtful feelings and memories out of our awareness. But these feelings and experiences remain trapped within our body and mind. We then give off a vibe that causes us to attract and become attracted to dysfunctional people who create even more confusion, pain and suffering in our lives.

Learn to “digest” the emotional baggage that keeps you trapped in unfulfilling relationships. Transform the deep seated patterns that cause you to attract people who are negative or abusive or who do not have the capacity to truly love you and be present with you.

Heal the loss of past loves. Heal the shame and the feelings unworthiness, rejection and abandonment. Become clearer about what you really want in life and in a companion. You will naturally attract and find yourself attracted to healthier people as you heal the wounded parts of yourself. More and more love will flow to you as you begin to experience true love and acceptance for yourself. Working with these practices will make it possible for you to cultivate inner beauty and to develop a presence that is very healing to others.

Develop the Kind of Warm Magnetic Presence That Will Attract a Healthy and Loving Partner
Many of us have learned to disconnect from our emotions and are not very present within our bodies. The stresses, emotions and life experiences that we fail to digest accumulate within our body and mind. These stagnant energies and emotions can extinguish our inner fire and passion. Stagnant energies decrease our desirability which makes us less attractive to others.

A body that if full of vital life force is infinitely more desirable. Become powerfully present while remaining centered within the core of your being. Exude warmth, passion, sensuality and desire.

Develop Your Intuition and Sensory Awareness
Heightened intuition and sensory awareness lets us know when it is safe for us to open up to another person. It helps us to understand where people are coming from. Our intuition also guides us to the people that we are meant to be with.

Use Your Relationships to Evolve Spiritually
Healing the hurts and resolving the issues awakens the part of the soul that resides within your body. Awakening your body-mind will enable you to develop a stronger connection with your higher self and the universal consciousness.

Develop Chi Power
Many systems of Chinese martial arts emphasize the development of the dan tien, which is our base of power in the lower abdomen. You will learn specific chi gong practices that will enable you to continually cultivate the chi/shakthi in the dan tien. Developing Chi Power enables you to create a powerful magnetic presence that draws others to you.

Create Healthier and More Fulfilling Relationships
Relationships have a way of bringing our core issues to the surface. Buried emotions and unresolved issues create barriers between ourselves and others. Our love grows stronger and our understanding deepens as we learn to “digest” our emotions, resolve important issues and express our feelings and needs in a healthy way.

Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.

Please go to http://www.doiohm.com... or call (913)[masked] for more information

I'm working out in the field much of the time and I have very limited access to the internet. Please call me at (913)[masked] if you have any questions and are interested in attending. I will be happy to answer any questions that you have about how you can heal from the loss of a love and develop a more attractive presence. Let me know in advance about your individual needs and concerns and we will address these issues during class.

Sign up for my free monthly internet journal at http://www.doiohm.com...

Please go to http://www.facebook.com/healthyandlovingrelationships

and click on the LIKE button at the top of the page to join the community and gain access to new articles.

results.description:
Make Yourself  Strong and Resourceful (Second Discussion)

Sura 16: Ayas 75-76

 God gives an example---- someone enslaved, owned by another, has no power over anything, and someone else  whom We have given good resources from ourselves and who spends from it at will, both privately and publicly. Are these two equal? Praise and thanks be to God: but most of them do not understand it.

 And God gives the example of two men---one of them dumb, powerless, and a burden on his master: to whichever task is he directed he brings no good.

 Can such a one be considered the equal of someone who commands justice and is on a firm path?

In these ayas two categories of people are described; there is a comparison  between a person who is powerless and clueless, unable to do anything right, versus someone who is resourceful, free to act and is generous in helping others.

In both verses there is a rhetorical question: can these two people be considered equal?  The answer is obvious.  God wishes you and me to be resourceful and have the ability to accomplish our objectives and help others.

 These verses tell us that if religious teachings contribute to personal growth, resourcefulness and fulfillment of potential for people who follow them then these represent the true purpose of religion. If on the other hand, religion is taught in ways that contribute to limitation, poverty and weakness then such teachings are false. You are welcome to bring healthy snacks to share after the meeting.


Our discussions are based on the book 'The Quran and The Life of Excellence.'

  Notice: The attendees will be requested to contribute $ 5 each to help with the cost of renting the meeting room.
results.name: Quran Discussion in Manhattan-- Make Yourself Strong and Resourceful

A mind that is calm, without anticipation and agitation is the birth right of all individuals. A mind that is in the present moment will be happy.

results.description:
PLEASE READ:

Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7-7:05 - chat

7:05-7:30 - introductions (please be on time for intros)

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 3,000 words or 10pgs max (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work

- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified

(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

See you there.
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication games (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation and what we have to offer so you can have the sex life and relationships that you really want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at this event are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us

results.description:
People ask me how I can speak seven languages all the time.

It's simple...

Study hard consistently, challenge yourself and use the language daily. That's how you'll get fluent in your target language. I study languages every day from six in the morning. Can you keep up? It'll make you fluent!


Join me at Starbucks whenever you'd like to study hard, practise conversation, and share good energy.

results.description:
LeTip of Hoboken

Are you looking for a way to successfully market your business? Want better, higher quality business leads? Then you have come to the right group. Survey after survey indicates that referral networking is the most cost-effective part of the marketing mix. By joining a LeTip chapter, savvy entrepreneurs are able to consistently prospect and be visible. LeTip of Hoboken has members that not only need and will use your business services, they also know others in need of your services. Each LeTip member acts as an extension to your sales and marketing team.

The LeTip Creed

LeTip is a professional networking organization of men and women dedicated to the highest standards of competence and service. Our purpose is the exchange of business tips. Members will, at all times, maintain the highest professional integrity. Each business category is represented by one member and conflicts of interest are disallowed.


A typical meeting has the following components to help you build your business: 

• You introduce your company at every meeting

• Your chapter passes qualified business Tips (Leads) throughout the meeting

• You Showboat your product two or more times a year, giving you ample opportunity to train your newfound sales force

• You have access to the expertise of other LeTip members, ongoing training and mentoring 

• Your chapter has the potential to provide a wide reach into the business community

• You become the speaker several times a year, putting the spotlight clearly on your business.


The following categories are no longer open:

Mortgage Banker
Realtor
Business Banker
Title Insurance
Real Estate Attorney
Life and Health Insurance
Accountant

results.description:
Come join us for an invigorating breakfast and networking event.

There will be at least 15 members at each meeting, regardless of how many people RSVP on Meetup.

Meet successful business owners from different professions to give and pass referrals and grow your personal network.

BNI, the largest business networking organization in the world, is a business and professional referral organization that allows only one person from each profession to join a chapter.  Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of sales people working for you because all the other members carry several copies of your business cards around with them. When they meet someone who could use your products or services they hand your card out and recommend your services. It's as simple as that!  

For 28 years BNI has used a simple but elegant philosophy that exemplifies membership, "Givers Gain," or, "what goes around comes around."

 Last year alone, Business Network Int'l generated over 7.1 million referrals resulting in more than $3.3 billion worth of business for its members!

In Manhattan, BNI currently has more than 1250 members in 53 Chapters. 

BRING LOTS OF BUSINESS CARDS!!!
Cost is $20, which includes breakfast.

results.description:
A mix is a great way to showcase your talent, the tracks that get you bumping and the tracks that have inspired you on the path of DJ-ing. So think of the bedroom as your house of worship. Honor it, pay reverence to it and give us a damn good mix worthy of the pantheon of the DJ gods on Mt. Olympus.

Some common ground rules to ensure a quality mix and ensure serious commitment:

•  House, deep-house, tech-house, techno, minimal, EDM or any other genre that fits into the house category.

• High quality mp3/wav 320kbps.

• Record a 1 hour mix without peaks, in other words; no clipping!

• Transitions need to be well segued, near flawless

• Sample mix required to ensure DJ commitment and whether or not you make the cut for the radio show

• A great profile pic

So once you’ve ticked all these off the list, you’re on your way to getting your DJ mix broadcasted. We’re especially reaching out to our new and beginning DJ's looking to make their mark. Send us a link where we can download your mix. Send us a profile picture too, so we can add it to the visual in case your mix has been selected for the weekly broadcast on Saturday (soundboxonline.com). Also check out Carl J and ADG presents where you can find all of our mixes back. Looking forward to hearing some great mixes.

Ayelmer Veenstra --- LMR

A.D.G.

~ pls. send the visual and the link to (download) your mix to: [masked]

Central Park Sightseeing has been following our dads group on social media for a long time and love our messaging as well as all of the photos of active dads with their children.  They are very generous in offering 12 dads and their children with Free bike and equipment rentals to go for a bike ride in Central Park. 


All of their 3 locations offer Baby Seats, Tag-a-Long Bikes, Bike double trailers, and tandem bikes, which no other bike establishment in the city offers. Each rider also receives a helmet, bike lock, and bike basket free of charge! Basically, they offer everything our members need to have an unforgettable day of biking!

* Bike Rental location is located just south of Central Park

* Dads WILL be able to leave strollers, baby carriers, or other gear at the bike shop while we rent our bicycles. Bike rentals will last for approximately 2 hours.

* Each dad will be able to rent a bike with child seat or trailer or additional bike for older child.  Bike helmet, lock, and baskets are included as well

* This experience is FREE for NYC Dads Group members. 

* Course: We'll plan to go for a leisurely bike ride around Central Park with a brief playground pit-stop

**After you RSVP, please make a note in comments section with age of child and request of bike seat, trailer, or 2nd bike for child 

You can learn more about Central Park Sightseeing here: http://www.centralparksightseeing.com/

results.description:
Attend one of 2 Public Hearings at the Public Service Commission office in Lower Manhattan on May 31 about the Clean Energy Standard.  Bring friends. 


Help express how much we want NYS to hurry and move to renewable energy such as offshore wind and solar and to energy efficiency and how much we don't want to subsidize nuclear power and the huge costs of dealing with radioactive, carcinogenic nuclear waste. Keep in mind that the proposal lists nuclear power as one of the energy sources that our Governor has included in the proposal. Nuclear is dirty, dangerous and not renewable so help us remove it from the proposal. 

For more info about the Clean Energy Standard, go to both:  www.allianceforagreeneconomy.org

and 

www.allianceforagreeneconomy.org/ces

"In a nutshell, the proposed policy will set annual goals for the amount of renewable energy to be purchased in New York, claiming to ensure a steadily increasing market for renewable energy. Despite the fact that nuclear power is not clean or renewable, the proposed policy will also provide massive subsidies to unprofitable upstate nuclear reactors. It will require utilities to buy nuclear energy at above-market rates to cover the rising operating costs of nuclear reactors. 

The costs of the proposal would be passed on from utilities to consumers."

Please help us fill both hearings and testify about the importance of moving to renewables and of removing nuclear and nuclear subsidies from this proposal.

A decision will be made in June so help make a difference by attending one of these hearings. 

There will be another Public Hearing on the same day at 2PM. Attend whichever you can.  Or both.

The first hour of each hearing will be info provided by the PS Commission explaining the proposed new standards.  The second+ hour will be your chance to tell them why:

1) subsidies for nuclear subvert the Clean Energy Standards and will result in costing consumers more for their electricity; 

2) renewables can play a much larger role than this plan gives them credit for;

3) nuclear power is not cheap or carbon-free and it's certainly not clean;

4) we have plenty of power from existing generators, transmission improvements, efficiency and conservation.

Show up early so you can sign up to testify.  If you're shy, show up to demonstrate your interest.
results.how_to_find_us: Lower Manhattan: NYS Public Service Commission at 90 Church St., Board Room, 4th Floor
results.name: Attend a Public Hearing about proposed Clean Energy Standard for NYS

results.description:
Rally 5pm, City Hall Park

Hearing 6pm, 90 Church St


On May 31st New Yorkers from across the city are going to be descending on the Clean Energy Standard hearing in lower Manhattan to help spark a renewable energy revolution in the Empire State. We need you there with us--for our climate, our economy, and the city we love. This is the big one. 

The Scoop: Governor Cuomo recently established a new 'Clean Energy Standard' that aims to have 50 percent of the state's energy come from renewables by 2030. We need to make sure this new goal is enforceable--that it actually compels utilities to purchase renewables--and that it includes a specific commitment to large-scale offshore wind development. Without any real teeth, the new Standard won't live up to its promises.

And without an offshore wind commitment, New York will miss out on a massive untapped renewable resource that could create thousands of new jobs. 

Can you join us at the hearing to demand an enforceable renewable energy plan that includes offshore wind?

Clean Energy Standard Public Hearing

Tuesday, May 31st, 6:00pm 90 Church St., New York, NY, 4th Floor

Rally+march nearby at 5:00pm, location City Hall Park

This hearing could impact New York's energy future for decades, so it's critical that we show up in force. 


Our plan is to rally nearby and then march to the hearing and pack the room with hundreds of New Yorkers. 

We encourage everyone who comes out to deliver testimony, and we'll help support you in preparing it.

Save the date in your calendar, RSVP HERE, and tell your friends. 

If we want a renewable energy future in New York, it's up to us to build it. The rubber hits the road on May 31st. 

Be there with us.
results.name: Sane Energy meeting moved to the CES Hearing!

results.description:
Updated March 7th, 2016

Given the warmth that has descended upon NYC, I am making Tuesdays/Thursdays active again, but at 5pm.

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. Our main location is Riverside Park, with Morningside and Booker T Washington as backups.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)
- Thursdays at 5pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien
[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

BOOKER T. WASHINGTON DETAILS

This location is between 107th & 108th Streets just West of Columbus Avenue. It's on the backside of the high school. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. 

+++

OTHER SEASONS...

WINTER (Nov - Feb)

During the colder months we generally play two times a week depending on weather. Our main location is Riverside Park with Morningside as a backup.

There are two days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
*Tuesdays/Thursdays at 6pm games don't last long due to decreasing sunlight.

FALL (Sep - Oct)

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave)
- Sundays at 4pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)

This event is currently at its maximum and is closed to new players.

From humble beginnings, a handful of lost souls must rise above their misfortune to achieve greatness.

The uncountable islands of the subtropical Korina Archipelago are the sanctuary for many who have fled from the never-ending wars of distant Altamere. That land, where the life of the common man is cheap and reckless kings all-too-often burn their lives, and kingdoms, out in blazes of glory.

The Korina Archipelago is home to several large city-states, each of which views the others as rivals, but generally coexist, for there are greater threats to their safety. Renegade Altameran privateers, depraved nation-less pirates, demon-worshiping cannibals, horrors from the uncharted oceans, and far worse are reminders for the city-states of the constant dangers that exist outside their walls. 

These dangers are all-too-real, and to whom can one turn to in times of desperation and need when threats arise? Each city-state will defend its own, but outside that, help is not easy to come by. Even the enlightened gods favor all, yet they favor none; those whose prayers and sacrifices are the most persuasive bend their ears for a time. The gods are powerful and wise, but fickle they are, too, and to understand their ways is not the way of man.

This is no place for the weak of heart. Salvation comes from strength and strength alone. The strong survive, the weak do not. This is the tale of the rising of heroes, the elevation of men from what they were to what they are, the making of the great from the small, this is the story of ascension.

results.description:
OVERVIEW

Join us for an exciting futuristic talk about developing Mixed & Virtual reality apps (and games). You'll learn about the various MR & VR hardware options – like Oculus Rift, HoloLens, Mobile VR, and more – and their SDKs. You'll also learn how to get started with VR & MR development using Visual Studio, Unity & C#. While this session is aimed at people who are completely new to this field, veteran VR developers are welcome to join the conversation.

See the full session abstract below.

EVENING DETAILS

6:00PM - PIZZA& NETWORKING: Doors open. Food will be served, courtesy of Microsoft. Please keep your RSVP up to date so we can properly assess how many developers to feed.

6:30PM - INTRODUCTION: Housekeeping, open mic and other community announcements & request.

6:45PM - MAIN PRESENTATION: See abstract below.

After the talk - Prize raffle courtesy of Microsoft, and other sponsors.

Your RSVP is required to add your name to the building security guest list. Please keep your RSVP up-to-date should you find yourself unable to come.

MAIN PRESENTATION

From Oculus to HoloLens: Building Virtual & Mixed Reality Apps & Games

For over 35 years, we have been content with using a keyboard and monitor to interact with computers. The mouse, touch screen and other input devices have transformed how to communicate with computers, but screens of all sizes – from 1” to 80” – have all always been the de facto method to perceive the primary output from our microcomputers and devices. Until now. The Oculus Rift aims to be the first mainstream consumer device for Virtual Reality (VR), while Microsoft’s HoloLens merges the real world with the virtual via holograms to create advanced mixed reality (MR) scenarios (also known as augmented reality, or AR).

This session is your introduction to building AR & MR applications and games using C#, Visual Studio and Unity. We’ll review many of the hardware options, their respective SDKs and how to design real-world scenarios for both the consumer space and the enterprise. We’ll also look at 3D development environments like Unity to bring to life complex scenarios. Mixed and Virtual Reality projects are no longer a dream. The technology is here. The hardware is here. The tools and SDKs are here. Come learn how to get started and build experiences beyond anything you ever imagined.

ABOUT THE PRESENTER

Nick Landry – Senior Technical Evangelist, Microsoft

Nick Landry (@ActiveNick) is a mobility pioneer and former entrepreneur specializing in cross-platform mobile app development for Windows, iOS and Android devices. Nick works at Microsoft as a Senior Technical Evangelist in the New York Metro area. He spent most his career in IT consulting, software and services companies across various technical and business roles, designing, building, managing and selling innovative software products and solutions for the world’s top brands and Fortune 500 companies.

Known for his dynamic and engaging style, he is a frequent speaker at major software development conferences worldwide, was a 10-year Microsoft MVP awarded on Windows Phone Development, and a Nokia Developer Ambassador & Champion. With over 24 years of professional experience, Nick is a certified developer and software architect by trade and specializes in Cross-Platform Mobility, IoT, Cloud, GIS, Computer Speech and Mobile Game Development. He is an active blogger, occasional author, avid gamer, loving husband and proud father.

Blog: www.AgeofMobility.com

GitHub: https://github.com/activenick

LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/in/activenick

Hope to see YOU at the movies!   Love, Cassie

Ok who LOVES the movies as much as me? Who has a limited entertainment budget like me? LOL Well this is the event for YOU!

My local theater has discount Tuesday every week and if you sign up online they will even send you a coupon for the concession stand, each week a different one (this weeks is free small popcorn with a drink purchase). They also have those awesome new reclining seats! And you get to choose and pay for your seat in advance so there is no rushing in at the last minute and sitting in the front row and straining your neck!  Here is the link to the theater for more details: http://www.cinemark.com/theatre-detail.aspx?node_id=83854

If you purchase tickets online and can’t make it to the theater, just respond to the email address you receive the confirmation email from ([masked]) and they can refund the payment remotely.

So here is how it's going to work each week. I will choose a movie when the new schedule goes out (Fri/Sat) and choose the movie and showtime. I will buy my seat online and post what row and number. Those of you who wish to join me can buy your seat near me. There are two ways to buy seats: 1) online in advance is your best bet but there is a $1.25 service fee per ticket unless you buy a gift card at the theater and pre-load it 2) At the theater no service fee but you really need to drive there in advance if you want seats near us. OR you can just show up that night and sit wherever there is space available.

Hope to see YOU at the movies!!    Love, Cassie

PS: I am doing this with my friendship group too so if you are S&L do wear your wristbands. These are loads of fun at the movies they glow in the dark!

if you can't make it, no need to post why. We understand and will catch you next time!

From their page: On Tuesday, May 31st we'll be exploring "The Forensics of Storytelling." The evening will examine the science of Sherlock Holmes and the lessons that can be applied to storytelling and experiential design. Our special guests for the evening will be members from the global collective The Baker Street Babes. The all-female group of Sherlock Holmes fans is dedicated to approaching the fandom from a female point of view, as well as engaging in fun, lively conversations about the canon, film and television adaptations of Arthur Conan Doyle’s work, and associated topics. After the talk/group discussion we'll shift our efforts to the design of the upcoming Sherlock Holmes & the Internet of Thingsevent during the New York Film Festival later this fall. This session will focus on ways to connect the various crime scenes that will be staged in over 20 cities around the world. We'll be designing, prototyping and testing our collective ideas with a variety of IoT solutions. In addition curators from the Film Society of Lincoln Center will be joining to give us an overview of the upcoming festival. About the program

Sherlock Holmes & the Internet of Things is a prototype from theDigital Storytelling Lab at Columbia University School of the Arts. We're pleased to be partnering with the Film Society of Lincoln Center on this exciting year-long program. For more info please visit http://sherlockholmes.io
results.name: The Forensics of Storytelling with the Baker Street Babes

Right at the busiest intersection of the world, lies a little Oasis, a true NYC treasure – Bryant Park, located between Fifth and Sixth Avenues and between 40th & 42nd Streets in Manhattan. Bryant Park is a great spot to visit at any time of the year, but during summer the biggest attraction is the lush green lawn which is open to public. Let's meet for a wonderful and relaxing evening at Bryant Park.


Time:  6.00 pm to 10.00 pm

Location: Upper Terrace.

Though its lush green space has existed for more than 150 years, it was a revitalization project of the 1990's that made it a sanctuary for locals and tourists alike.


Bryant Park is a lovely green space spread out among landmarks and skyscrapers and is one of Manhattan's most popular parks. Tall London Plane trees line the perimeter of the sunny central lawn, overlooking stone terraces, formal flower beds, gravel pathways, and a smattering of kiosks. 


Bryant Park is visited by over 6 million people each year and is one of the busiest public spaces in the world. Check out everything you can do in the park year round at http://www.bryantpark.org


It is one of the best locations to unwind, people watch and enjoy the ambiance and the intriguing acoustics of the Big Apple. It's small, and has a great location with easy walking distance to many interesting things - NYC Public Library, Grand Central, interesting shops and restaurants.

What to bring: Please bring enough food for yourself. You may want to bring a blanket or beach towel to sit on. Be sure to bring beverages to drink, including water. Everything else is up to you. If you do wish to share food, just keep in mind that not everyone has exactly the same level of dietary restrictions. Any food you bring must be vegetarian or vegan. 


</a>

<a href="http://www.centralparknyc.org/visit/things-to-see/north-end/great-hill.html">

</a>

<a href="http://www.centralparknyc.org/visit/things-to-see/north-end/great-hill.html">

<a href="http://www.centralparknyc.org/visit/things-to-see/north-end/great-hill.html"></a>

Location (Very Important): We will meet at the Upper Terrace section (near Bryant Park Grill) of the Park (see the map above -- we will meet exactly where the words "Upper Terrace" are on the map above) and then move to the lawn closest to the Upper Terrace. Both on the Upper Terrace and also when we move to the lawn, look for a sign that says "VEG MEETUP".


For those of you who have never attended one of our Meetup events: this is an incredibly friendly & welcoming group. If this is your first-time event, we welcome you to join us and make some wonderful vegetarian & vegan friends. (And all you regular members already know what great members we have, so please come join us on this beautiful day.)


By subway: Take the B, D, F, or M train to 42nd Street/Bryant Park.

We are looking forward to seeing you, hanging out, and enjoying veg*n food on this beautiful spring day. Let's have a picnic!

Gaurav

Our special guests for the evening will be members from the global collective The Baker Street Babes.  The all-female group of Sherlock Holmes fans is dedicated to approaching the fandom from a female point of view, as well as engaging in fun, lively conversations about the canon, film and television adaptations of Arthur Conan Doyle’s work, and associated topics.

A collaboration with the Film Society of Lincoln Center, Crossroads is recorded in front a live audience at the Elinor Bunin Munroe Auditorium during our monthly meetups. +_+_+_+_+_+_+_+_+_+_+_+_Please sign up on this page ahead of time so security will have your information.  For Building Security purposes, please provide your Full Name.

Join us at MediaMath for food, drinks, networking and a great tech talk.

AGENDA:

• 6-630pm Food, Drinks and Networking

• [masked]pm Building effective near-real-time analytics with Spark Streaming and Kudu

• [masked]pm Networking

Spark Streaming allows developers to create streaming pipelines that harness the rich Spark API, and Kudu is a new storage layer that is able to capture the output of a stream in the same place that analytics users can then query that same data. Together these Hadoop ecosystem components allow for some exciting near-real-time analytics use cases. In this talk Cloudera will explore what is possible with this combination, how to efficiently develop these pipelines, and how to identify and avoid the pitfalls. This talk will be led by Jeremy Beard, Senior Solutions Architect at Cloudera.

Food & Refreshments Provided.
results.name: Building effective near-real-time analytics with Spark Streaming and Kudu

This meetup group was started by the founder of the DaniWeb.com IT Discussion Community who was getting frustrated that all of the meetups she was interested in attending were based in NYC, and it was nearly impossible to get to them on weeknights for people who work out on Long Island.

Join a group of people who work in the tech industry throughout Long Island.

We are a very informal group consisting mostly of web developers and IT consultants, with the occasional application developer thrown into the mix. We talk about the latest projects we're working on and get help and feedback from each other.

The meetup starts at 6 pm but running as late as 10 or 11 pm (sometimes even later!) is the norm. People typically arrive anytime between 6 pm and 9 pm, so don't miss out just because you can't get there by 6. There's usually an early crowd and a late crowd.
