results.description:
RSVP HERE


Please join the Design for Aging Committee at their May 31st event. 

Research is happening at multiple scales and in different arenas on the topic of designing for the aging population, from promoting individual health and well-being to understanding what constitutes a supportive community for seniors.  

This panel will explore how academic and independent research produces knowledge that can be utilized by designers so that environments can be created in an age-friendly manner.

Panelists: 

BILL ARMBRUSTER has been with AARP since 2000, joining as an Associate State Director for AARP New York. In that role Bill served the upstate and western region of the Empire State and was responsible for the development, implementation and assessment for community outreach programming. That body of work included livable and age-friendly communities initiatives, partner development and grassroots organizing.  In his current role, he coordinates the AARP Network of Age Friendly Communities (which currently has over 90 communities
enrolled, impacting over 44 million lives) and serves as national advisor for states and communities that want to become more livable for all ages. In addition to his work at AARP,

Bill has extensive experience in corporate wellness programs, occupational rehabilitation and ergonomics. He brings his ergonomics expertise, which by its simplest definition is a science that deals with designing and arranging things so that people can use them easily and safely at work and translates these principles into the creation of Livable Communities. 

JEFF ROSENFELD has been researching the causes of serious geriatric falls for the past 5 months, with the goal of creating more effective Fall-Prevention programs. Thanks to a grant from Parsons School of Design, he has been gathering data on the incidence and prevalence geriatric falls,[masked], as in the ER at New York Methodist Hospital, in Park Slope, Brooklyn.

Dr. Rosenfeld is especially interested in ways that décor contributes to the incidence and prevalence of geriatric falls in the home. At the moment, Dr. Rosenfeld is exploring rates of geriatric falls for “Floor Cultures,” (i.e., cultures where it is the norm to sit and sleep closer to
the floor), as compared that of “Chair & Bed Cultures” among elderly patients who seek medical attention because they sustained a serious fall at home.
The research on ethnically-themed differences in geriatric falls is informed by Jeff’s abiding interest in cross-cultural comparisons. Along with Wid Chapman, AIA, he is author of Home Design in an Aging World (Bloomsbury Press, 2009), which explores differences in senior housing design for 6 of the world’s most rapidly aging nations; and UnAssisted Living(Monacelli Press, 2012), also written with Wid Chapman, AIA.


MILDRED WARNER is a Professor in the Department of City and Regional Planning at Cornell University where her work focuses primarily on local government service delivery, economic and community development. Dr. Warner’s research explores the challenges for cities, suburbs and rural communities in meeting the needs of both families with young children and an aging population. She helps city planners explore new models that link the care needs of children, parent and elders with economic development, and she works with employers to incorporate care supports into their human resource policy. Her work on Planning Across Generations explores models to address the needs of both young children and seniors through
shared service delivery, accessible design of built environments and shared vision around common needs.


Dr. Warner has a Ph.D. in Development Sociology, a Masters in Agricultural Economics from Cornell University and a BA in History from Oberlin College. She is author of numerous refereed articles and book chapters and has received major research grants from the USDA to assess the prospects for multigenerational planning and shared service delivery, and to explore environmental sustainability actions of local governments. She has also received grants from the US Dept of Health and Human Services, Peppercorn and Kellogg foundations
to explore the links between economic development and child care. Copies of recent articles and research can be found at her website www.mildredwarner.org<a href="http://www.mildredwarner.org"></a>

Moderator:

LORRAINE G. HIATT, PH.D. is a NYC based environmental psychologist/gerontologist and the sole proprietor of a woman owned business since 1980.  Lorraine collaborates with a variety of US design teams and sponsors, drawing on 55+, mature elders including implications for residences and community life:  housing, aging in place, health and memory care, commercial, leisure and cultural settings.   She has also work on design for medically fragile and developmentally delayed children and on intergenerational living.

Dr. Hiatt has been traveling an average of 200+ days a year for forty years to facilitate participatory planning and has completed 800 elder-friendly projects: "new", "renovated" and "repositioned".

See you there. Written rules for SuperFight:

SUPERFIGHT BASIC RULES

The Setup:
Separate the white-backed cards
(characters) and the black-backed cards
(attributes).

Youngest player goes first. Player one
starts by drawing three white cards and
three black cards. You can look at them,
but don’t let anyone else see them.
Player two (the next player to the left) does
the same.

Each player chooses one white card and
one black card from their hand to create a
fighter and places those cards face down.
Then they discard their remaining cards
into two separate piles (one for characters,
one for attributes).
Next, both players turn over their cards and
reveal their fighters.
Each player then draws a random black
card from the deck and adds it to their
fighter.

The Superfight:
Both players argue and plead their cases
about why their fighters would win the fight.
Once the arguing is done, the table votes
for a winner.

In the event of a tie, both players draw a
random white card and fight to the death
with no attributes. The table votes again. Do
this until there is a winner, then discard the
white cards from the tiebreaker fights.
The winning fighter stays on the table for
the next player to fight and will not get any
new attributes in the next fight. The player
who won the fight earns one point.

The Next Match:
Player three (the next player to the left) now
creates a fighter to battle the winner from
the last match, following the same rules for
fighter creation as in The Setup. Then The
Superfight begins again.

ALTERNATE RULES

Villain Battle:
Separate the white-backed cards
(characters) and the black-backed cards
(attributes).

Every player draws three white cards and
three black cards. You can look at them, but
don’t let anyone else see them. The least liked
person at the table takes the first turn
as the Villain.

The Villain chooses one white card and one
black card from their hand and places those
cards face up on the table. Then the Villain
draws one random black card from the
deck and adds it to their fighter.

All other players choose one white card and
one black card from their hands to create
fighters to defeat the Villain. When everyone
is ready, reveal the fighters one at a time and
announce them to the table. Starting with the
player to the left of the Villain, play an
additional black card from your hand onto
any fighter on the table (including the Villain
or yourself!) and then discard the rest of your
hand.

Next the Villain picks who would do the best
against his or her fighter. That fighter wins
the battle and gets one point.
The player to the left of the current Villain
becomes the new Villain. Every player draws
three new white cards and three new black
cards, and a new battle begins.

Battle Royale:

Separate the white-backed cards
(characters) and the black-backed cards
(attributes).

All players draw three white cards and three
black cards. You can look at them, but don’t
let anyone else see them. Each player places
one white card and one black card face
down on the table. One at a time, players
reveal their fighters and announce the
fighters to the table.

Before playing the second black card, select
one of the following game modes:

A) Each fighter’s second black card is drawn
randomly from the deck.

B) Players may play one additional black
card from their hands onto any fighter at
the table (including themselves).
Everyone votes on which fighter would be
the last one standing.

Pacifists:
Follow any of the rules outlined above, but
this time choose the winner based on who
is the funniest, or imagine it’s a dating
website and you’re picking the best match.
Pick who would be the best construction
worker, or nanny, or use your imagination!

Finally:
Unlike other judge-based games, this is not
anonymous. If a player is being biased, for
whatever dumb reason, never play with
that person again. They are lame, and
should go play charades with their cats
until they learn how to play with people.
Imagine the fighters are fighting on an
island or anywhere you want, but New York
is a good default.

results.description:
Attend one of 2 Public Hearings at the Public Service Commission office in Lower Manhattan on May 31 about the Clean Energy Standard.  Bring friends. 

Help express how much we want NYS to hurry and move to renewable energy such as offshore wind and solar and to energy efficiency and how much we don't want to subsidize nuclear power and the huge costs of dealing with radioactive, carcinogenic nuclear waste.  Keep in mind that the proposal lists nuclear power as one of the energy sources that our Governor has included in the proposal. Nuclear is dirty, dangerous and not renewable so help us remove it from the proposal. 


For more info about the Clean Energy Standard, go to both:  www.allianceforagreeneconomy.org

and 

www.allianceforagreeneconomy.org/ces

"In a nutshell, the proposed policy will set annual goals for the amount of renewable energy to be purchased in New York, claiming to ensure a steadily increasing market for renewable energy. Despite the fact that nuclear power is not clean or renewable, the proposed policy will also provide massive subsidies to unprofitable upstate nuclear reactors. It will require utilities to buy nuclear energy at above-market rates to cover the rising operating costs of nuclear reactors. 


The costs of the proposal would be passed on from utilities to consumers."

Please help us fill both hearings and testify about the importance of moving to renewables and of removing nuclear and nuclear subsidies from this proposal.


A decision will be made in June so help make a difference by attending one of these hearings. 

There will be another Public Hearing on the same day at 2PM. Attend whichever you can.  Or both.

The first hour of each hearing will be info provided by the PS Commission explaining the proposed new standards.  The second+ hour will be your chance to tell them why:

1) subsidies for nuclear subvert the Clean Energy Standards and will result in costing consumers more for their electricity; 

2) renewables can play a much larger role than this plan gives them credit for;

3) nuclear power is not cheap or carbon-free and it's certainly not clean;


4) we have plenty of power from existing generators, transmission improvements, efficiency and conservation.


Show up early so you can sign up to testify.  If you're shy, show up to demonstrate your interest.
results.how_to_find_us: NYS Public Service Commission at 90 Church St., Board Room, 4th Floor
results.name: Attend a Public Hearing about proposed Clean Energy Standard for NYS

We have lots of Arduinos, breadboards, and parts, so bring your laptop and come join us for a fun hands-on learning experience.

As usual, people are welcome to come and work on their own projects, and we will show new users how to install the Arduino development software on their laptops and get started connecting sensors and output devices.

--------------------------------------------------------------

Stewart Newfeld, our Arduino Tuesdays host has a an Electrical Engineering degree from Rutgers University, years of industry experience, and loves to teach and share his enthusiasm for making things. He enjoys ordering those so-inexpensive electronic parts from ebay and Aliexpress and having them show up like little toys two to three weeks later in his mailbox. He is president of Zebra Systems, Inc. where he develops websites with the Joomla Open Source CMS.

results.description:
You're invited to hack along with the New York Linux Users Group!


Please have a government issued form of ID with you.


This is a peer-supported workshop where we get together to share current challenges and approaches to solving problems or to just work alongside like-minded individuals and learn through osmosis.

This event is NOT a lecture-style meeting. The agenda is generally set when someone poses a question, so bring questions!

Some topics up for discussion are:

• Install and configuration assistance

• Documentation, standards, and best practices

• Current events/Conventions

• Release testing and bug reporting

• Getting started with languages like Python and LaTeX

• -Other projects (Pi/Arduino/Analog devices)

We will also have brief (approx. 5-10 minute) lightning talks, so please speak with a coordinator if you're interested in sharing some of your work.

A laptop is not required but strongly recommended.

Bring a project, topic, and questions and work with other enthusiasts on using Linux or get assistance with your own Linux/Open Source projects. Geeks are more sociable solving problems rather then just talking about themselves.
results.how_to_find_us: Enter the building, go to the 6th floor, follow signs on wall.

OPEN TO ALL! NO PREVIOUS UNDERSTANDING OR KNOWLEDGE NEEDED & 

THANKS FOR TAKING THE TIME TO READ THIS!

Save the date! Bring your questions & thoughts. This month we will do our best to cover some of the security issues and hacker news of the day. We also will have a special guest (who will talk about their work).

#harlemcryptoparty

# I AM A PRO & WANT TO SPEAK, PRESENT, HELP OUT

security pros interested in helping out? volunteering? contact: 
geminiimatt[at}protonmail.com via secure email &/or otr 
pgp signature: 381A B2F[masked] B00C  467F 0B87 70AA[masked] 
pgp pubkey: <a href="http://pgp.mit.edu/pks/lookup?op=get&search=0x0B8770AA07046231"></a>http://pgp.mit.edu/pks/lookup?op=get&search=0x0B8770AA07046231 

# WHAT'S A CRYPTOPARTY ## ## ## ## 
Cryptoparty Harlem: 

Sorry no chips, dip, awesome music or drinks. Just food for your mind. Ever wonder how to stay private, safe, & secure in today's digital age? What is a cryptoparty anyway? A CryptoParty is free, public and fun. People bring their computers, mobile devices,  and a willingness to learn! In the time of the event, people will learn and teach how to use basic cryptography tools. Cryptoparties are decentralized global events that are organized to answer questions and instruct people on technology & privacy. Cryptoparties are always free to attend, public, commercially and politically non-aligned and absolutely against sexual harassment and discrimination.

There are no dumb questions, you do not need to know anything about this subject, nor do you even need to bring a computer or phone. However that will help you get the most of it. 

This event is always open to everyone and free. We spend hours promoting the event in the community each month not just online. We purposely hand our flyers to anyone & everyone. We also do not ever discriminate. All are welcome regardless of gender/gender non-conformity, age, technical knowledge, race, class, privilege,sexual orientation,etc. Harlem is a diverse beautiful melting pot and we want to represent that.  


For more information see the global cryptoparty website:

</a>http://www.cryptoparty.in/

# WHERE ## ## ## ##

Creative Workspace @ HBA 
@CreativeWrkspce 
The #Harlem co-working space located at 
275 Lenox Avenue (also known as Malcom X Blvd) 
NY,NY 
10027

"Power to the Creatives!"

* always free $

closest train 2/3 to 125th Street Station

short wallk from A/B/C/D/ 125th Street Station

ok walk from 4/5/6 125th Street Station

# WHEN ## ## ## ##

Tuesday, May 31st, 2016 @ 5:45pm (-9pm)

# WHY ## ## ## ##

we will be available to answer, discuss, teach, and learn about secure mobile use, secure browsing (using tor), secure email (using gpg), and secure chat (using otr).  

# BUT WHY HARLEM?! ## ## ##

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EDq-OzMWQwg

 A lot of people don't know that back in December of 2013 NYC lauched The Harlem WiFi network (<a href="http://harlemfreewifi.com/">http://harlemfreewifi.com/) rolled out by Sky-Packets ( </a>http://www.sky-packets.com/muni-wifi/ ) it extends 95 city blocks, from 110th to 138th Streets between Frederick Douglass Boulevard and Madison Avenue making it at the time the largest continuous free outdoor public wireless network in the nation. The internet is literally all around us and free in Harlem! Throw in the fact that african americans over index on mobile phone usage (<a href="http://www.pewinternet.org/2014/01/06/african-americans-and-technology-use/">92% of African Americans own a cell phone, and 56% own a smartphone). So what better place to learn about using tech safely.

@geminiimatt has lived in harlem for over a decade and has seen it change for the good & bad. However one thing that has stayed the same is the high level of surveillance & scrutiny faced by residents.  ONLINE: Please read Ben Popper's examination of the fallout from NYPD's Operation Crew Cut ,  "How the NYPD is using social media to put Harlem teens behind bars" (http://www.theverge.com/2014/12/10/7341077/nypd-harlem-crews-social-media-rikers-prison) , ON THE CORNER: Via official nypd cctv surveillance cameras & private owned cameras & FROM UP ABOVE: via SkyWatch tactical platform units and shotspotter (</a>https://www.aclu.org/blog/free-future/shotspotter-ceo-answers-questions-gunshot-detectors-cities), gunshot detection devices. 

Our objective is to liberate the people of Harlem. We have sky watch towers on our streets, we have flood lights in our public housing courtyards, we have remote control surveillance cameras on our corners, automatic license place readers scan the roads, and shot stopper microphones listen from the rooftops. whenever there is a protest, cell phone calls & text are intercepted by stingrays. The inner city is the test bed for these technologies, many of which were designed to fight the war on terror. If this surveillance over reach & over policing isnt confronted in the urban areas of this country who knows where it will grow to next.

results.description:
Pivotal, NYU's GovLab and the 21st Century Democracy and Technology Meetup are pleased to welcome Code for America's founder, Jennifer Pahlka, to talk about the state of government tech, with case studies enabled by Code for America fellows and alumni. 

Code for America is a national nonprofit that believes government can work for the people, by the people, in the 21st century. CfA organizes a network of people who build technology to further local governments' priorities of creating healthy, prosperous, and safe communities.

Jennifer Pahlka is the founder and executive director of Code for America. She recently served as the U.S. Deputy Chief Technology Officer in the White House Office of Science and Technology Policy, where she architected and helped found the United States Digital Service. She is known for her TED talk, Coding a Better Government, and is the recipient of several awards, including MIT’s Kevin Lynch Award, the Oxford Internet Institute’s Internet and Society Award, and the National Democratic Institute’s Democracy Award. She is a graduate of Yale University and lives in Oakland, California with her daughter, husband, and seven chickens.

Twitter: @pahlkadot
LinkedIn: http://www.linkedin.com/in/jpahlka

“By the middle of this century we will trigger runaway climate change — a process beyond our control. What do you do if you have that information? What do you do?” – Dr. Steven Chu, Former U.S. Energy Secretary and Nobel Prize winner

Climate change may be the biggest challenge humanity has ever faced. There are solutions, but we are in a race against the clock to respond to this critical global threat. In Time To Choose, Academy Award® winner Charles Ferguson (Inside Job, No End In Sight) explores the far-reaching effects of the climate change crisis and examines the potential of solutions already available and the promise of those to come. 

Shot on five continents, from the oil fields of Nigeria to the forests of Indonesia and the coal mines of Appalachia, Time To Choose investigates the costs that fossil fuels and industrialized agriculture take on human lives and future of the land. Through interviews with clean energy and environmental entrepreneurs; innovators in urban planning and design; global and local leaders; and the grassroots activists working on the frontlines of climate change, the film takes an in-depth look at many of the remarkable people working to save our planet. 

Join New America for a screening of Time To Choose and a conversation with the film's director and leading climate advocates on what may very well be the next greatest political issue of our time. 

Charles Ferguson http://www.newamerica.org/nyc/events/time-choose/

(Photo of Civic Hall front)

A Social Cinema Screening

RSVP

When

May 31, 2016

6:30 pm - 8:30 pm  (ADDED by Yen - For those interested discussing this film after this event, meetup at the back of auditorium after this event and we will walk together to Argo Tea.)


Where

Civic Hall

156 Fifth Avenue, Second Floor

New York, NY 10010

“By the middle of this century we will trigger runaway climate change — a process beyond our control. What do you do if you have that information? What do you do?” – Dr. Steven Chu, Former U.S. Energy Secretary and Nobel Prize winner

Climate change may be the biggest challenge humanity has ever faced. There are solutions, but we are in a race against the clock to respond to this critical global threat. In Time To Choose, Academy Award® winner Charles Ferguson (Inside Job, No End In Sight) explores the far-reaching effects of the climate change crisis and examines the potential of solutions already available and the promise of those to come.

Shot on five continents, from the oil fields of Nigeria to the forests of Indonesia and the coal mines of Appalachia, Time To Choose investigates the costs that fossil fuels and industrialized agriculture take on human lives and future of the land. Through interviews with clean energy and environmental entrepreneurs; innovators in urban planning and design; global and local leaders; and the grassroots activists working on the frontlines of climate change, the film takes an in-depth look at many of the remarkable people working to save our planet.

Join New America for a screening of Time To Choose and a conversation with the film's director and leading climate advocates on what may very well be the next greatest political issue of our time.

Charles Ferguson <a>@CharlesFerguson</a>
Director and Writer, Time To Choose
Winner, 2011 Academy Award® for Best Documentary Feature, Inside Job 

James Hansen
Director, Program in Climate Science, Awareness and Solutions, Columbia University's Earth Institute
Former Head, NASA Goddard Institute for Space Studies

Vishaan Chakrabarti <a>@vishaannyc</a>
Founder, Partnership for Architecture and Urbanism
Author, "A Country of Cities: A Manifesto for an Urban America"

Sharon E. Burke <a>@burkese</a>
Senior Advisor, Resource Security Program, New America
Former Assistant Secretary of Defense for Operational Energy, Obama Administration

http://www.newamerica.org/nyc/events/time-choose/

(Photo of Civic Hall front)

(Photo of Argo Tea front)  http://www.yelp.com/biz/argo-tea-new-york-5

results.description:
Note: This is a cultural event. Most people will simply go to see the performance. Seats are limited and your seat is not guaranteed unless you also RSVP to the sponsor directly. There is no organizer from our group present at this event, please see staff on site with any questions.


How do I RSVP with the sponsor? 

Send e-mail to [masked] with your first & last name and the date of the event.



What is it?

Deutsches Haus at NYU presents a concert, The Diary of Clara and Robert Schumann, by New York Poetry and Song.


Robert Schumann and Clara Wieck met when he was seventeen and she a pianist prodigy of eight years old. What unfolded over the ensuing years, as Robert briefly studied piano with Clara’s father and even boarded with the Wiecks, was a bond that blossomed into a romance. They would have to fight for their right to get married. Which they did, some twelve years later. The diary that began the first day of their marriage (September 13, 1840) was a weekly exchanged collection of their thoughts and business of the past week. The teasing tone of Robert’s statute to keep this co-journal, and Clara’s sincere and heartfelt consent, are a peek into their relationship and a foretaste of the diary that follows: 

"If you agree with all this, wife of my heart, then sign your name underneath mine....I am truly your sincerely loving husband Robert, and you?" Clara responds with her signature underneath: "I too, your wife, Clara, who is devoted to you with her entire soul."

It is little wonder that their union should have been sweetened by initial struggle; but it was fortified by an intense love for one another, and for music.

This program presents songs from Robert Schumann’s Myrthen, Op. 25, as well as their one cooperative compositional effort, Robert’s Op. 37 and Clara’s Op. 12. In Myrthen, as in the diary, we find inside-jokes and gems, many composed while his future with Clara was yet uncertain. Robert had this “bouquet of songs” beautifully bound and given to Clara as a wedding present. The act of gifting one another music became a tradition in the Schumann household and prompted Robert’s desire that they should do something together. The result is the intertwining Op. 37/Op. 12, all of which use the poems from Friedrich Rückert’s

Liebesfrühling

 (Love’s Springtime) – poems he wrote while courting his own wife.

The diary provides an intimate portrait into the lives of these artists: "our wishes, our hopes shall be recorded therein...it should also be a little book of requests that we direct toward one another whenever words are insufficient". These songs reach this same mark, where words are insufficient.

New York Poetry and Song is a concert series with the chief aim of creating coherent programs that engage the listener, irrespective of their previous exposure to classical music. Using songs, chamber music, and/or solo piano music, programs are bundled together by a cohesive thread to help the audience connect to the music. Linking ideas are discussed between pieces to allow listeners a big-picture scheme to hold on to. The entirety is presented in a digestible hour-long, intermission-free venture.

Artists: Sung Chung, Jazimina MacNeil, Suna Chung

Events at Deutsches Haus are free and open to the public. If you would like to attend this event, please send an email to 

[masked].

Since space at Deutsches Haus is limited, please arrive ten minutes prior to the event to ensure you get a good seat. Thank you!

Deutsches Haus @ NYU is the host for this event.  They have staff members on site.

Please only RSVP if you mean it and update it if your plans change. It helps more than you might think and is highly appreciated. Thank you!

Thomas

results.description:
Have you ever thought about trying, or have already tried crowdfunding for your startup?

While some find success in this method of raising capital, for the most part entrepreneurs fall short of their desired goal when trying to raise funds through crowdfunding.

Crowdfunding comes with many more complexities than just listing your startup on a crowdfunding site and waiting, and that is what we hope to shed some light on with this event!

We have two great speakers for this event who have extensive experience in the startup and crowdfunding space!

Jason Vitug

Jason Vitug is an author, speaker, and social impact entrepreneur as founder of personal finance website and lifestyle brand ­ Phroogal. He is a self described financial motivator and lifestyle engineer helping thousands of people around the country live their dream lifestyle through financial knowledge.

Jason is the promoter of The Smile Lifestyle movement, a community of over 60,000 millennials who are living purposeful lives and making informed financial decisions to stop wasting time and money, and focus on the things that matter. The movement is based on a belief that experiential and purposeful living can be achieved through sound financial decision making.

In 2012, Jason left his senior executive role and backpacked around the world visiting 20 countries in 12 months. It was in this journey he created his purpose and in 2013 started Phroogal as a personal finance blog. Phroogal became the most successful personal finance related crowd funding campaign raising $78,501 with the support of 541 people.

Jason is the creator of the award winning project The Road to Financial Wellness, a grassroots and social media campaign to break the social taboo about money and empower a generation to live their dreams. In 2015, Jason and his team completed a 10,218 mile road trip across the United States, and participated in 37 events in 30 locations, attended by over 8,000 people in 30 days.

Those who attend this event will also receive a free copy of Jason’s Book:

“Crowdfunding a Bootstrapped Startup: The Story of How We Hacked Our Way To Success”

Rick Colosimo

Rick J. Colosimo focuses on the representation of companies in all aspects of their business, including corporate governance, transactional, and commercial matters.

Rick’s diverse legal practice ranges from providing complex, “bet-the-company” transactional and corporategovernance advice to independent directors and stakeholders in closely held businesses to structuring new businesses for startup founders positioning themselves to raise capital; from assisting nonprofit organizations undergoing strategic reviews to advising organizers of new nonprofit entities how to obtain state and federal tax exemptions. 


As outside general counsel for many clients, Rick connects deeply with their businesses — serving on corporate boards, creating financial models and fundraising presentations for startups, and analyzing strategic problems in transactions and litigation to frame issues properly for better-informed corporate decisions. These business skills have been buttressed by years of merger and acquisition advisory work for clients including deal prospecting, due diligence, negotiation, financial modeling, and deal execution. Rick’s clients come from many industries: software, ecommerce, web and Internet, clothing retailers and fashion designers, financial services, computer hardware, IT consulting, strategy consulting, construction materials, import/export, enterprise software, and contract manufacturing. 


Rick has a wide array of legal experience on which to draw: he practiced in both New York City and in Silicon Valley at large national law firms. He has been involved in hundreds of negotiations across a wide variety of disciplines. In New York City, Rick practiced at Holland & Knight LLP, litigating mass torts involving pesticides, asbestos, and the crash of TWA Flight 800. He then practiced corporate and securities law at Brobeck, Phleger & Harrison LLP, in the Palo Alto, CA office, where his practice included venture financing, and mergers and acquisitions for startups, venture capital funds, E*Trade, and Cisco Systems.

Here’s what to expect from the event:

• Common misconceptions about crowdfunding

• The legal side of crowdfunding

• Jason’s successful crowdfunding story

• A “roadmap”, or best practices to a successful crowdfunding campaign

Schedule:

We are on a tighter time frame due to timing restrictions at the library, but we will continue our networking afterwards at 54 Main Bar & Grille.

6:30 - 6:45: Event begins. Networking and refreshments.
6:45 - 8:15: Crowdfunding talk kicks off.
8:15 - 8:30: Event wrap up.
8:30 - 9:30: Networking over at 54 Main Bar & Grille.

Where to find us:

Madison Public Library (39 Keep Street, Madison NJ) in the Helen Whitney Chase Auditorium.

results.description:
The Beginner Buddhist Book Circle is for anyone interested in or new to Buddhism. In this biweekly series, we’ll explore classic introductory Buddhist books. Although we have “reading assignments”, the meetings focus more on basic Buddhist teachings rather than strict discussions of the books. Our meetings are casual and informal; all levels of interest and experience are welcome. When possible, we’ll have copies of the current book available at no cost. Meetings occur on the second Wednesday and fourth Thursday of the month unless otherwise noted. Please see the Meetup page and calendar for the full schedule.

*** Right Now We’re Reading: “The Heart of the Buddha's Teachings" by Thich Nhat Hanh***

In "The Heart of the Buddha's Teachings", renowned Vietnamese Buddhist monk, teacher, poet, and peace activist Thich Nhat Hanh (Thay) presents the essentials of Buddhist teachings in a clear, compassionate, and concise manner. In addition to covering teachings at the core of all Buddhist traditions, Thay also covers many key Mahayana Buddhist teachings. In all discussions, Thay helps guide us to the heart of what the Buddha taught; the transformation of suffering into peace, joy, and liberation.

First released in 1999, "The Heart of the Buddha's Teachings" has become a classic and essential read for anyone interested in learning more about basic Buddhist teachings. The book is widely available in bookstores and libraries in print, ebook form, and audio book form.


For the May 31st meeting, please read through Chapter 27.

Discussion points include:

-What is Interdependent Co-Arising? (Dependent Origination)?


-What is the Wheel of Life?


-How does Interdependent Co-Arising fit into the wider context of the Buddha's Teachings?


***

Happy reading and we hope to see you soon!
results.name: Beginner Buddhist Book Circle

results.description:
Filme baseado na obra de Nelson Rodrigues. Com apoio do Consulado Brasileiro em New York e Sacha Rodrigues, neto do escritor. * Português com legenda em Inglês


Film based on the work of Nelson Rodrigues. Supported by the Consulate General of Brazil in New York and Sacha Rodrigues, Nelson Rodrigues' grandson.


*Portuguese with English subtitles


Após ser atropelada, a bela Alaíde (Simone Spoladore) é levada para o hospital com muitas dores, alucinação e perda de memória. Ela se lembra de sua vida desde o momento em que leu o diário da cafetina Madame Clessi (Marília Pera), ao mudar-se para a casa que fora há 37 anos um bordel. Nesse misto de alucinação e memória, ela se encontra com a mítica cafetina, a quem conta tudo o que se passou. Alaíde também consegue se lembrar das brigas que teve com sua irmã, que amava o homem que na época era seu noivo e depois tornou-se seu marido. Outra lembrança é que horas antes do atropelamento, Alaíde tinha descoberto o plano de sua irmã e seu marido para matá-la e, após sua morte, se casarem. Mas isto ela não sabe se realmente aconteceu ou é mero fruto de sua imaginação.

Estreia de Joffre Rodrigues, filho do autor da peça, Nelson Rodrigues, como diretor de longa-metragens.


Trailer: https://youtu.be/WKFCXS5AzSU

Brazilian theatre truly hit its stride during the modern period, particularly in the 1940s with the Brazilian Comedy Theatre of São Paulo and with the playwright Nelson Rodrigues of Rio de Janeiro, whose Freudian drama Vestido de noiva (1943; The Wedding Dress), with its revolutionary staging and open treatment of sexuality, became one of Brazil’s most important dramas. Concerned with issues of class, machismo, sexual deviancy, incest, violence, and abortion, Rodrigues’s audacious plays have been praised for their different narrative levels. ( http://www.britannica.com/art/Brazilian-literature#ref[masked])


About Nelson Rodrigues:

http://www.nytimes.com/2000/12/17/theater/theater-reawakening-the-giant-of-brazilian-theater.html?pagewanted=all

results.description:
Join us for an incredible private wine tasting with several other similar Meetup groups. Meet in a private wine cellar and taste wines from all over the world. We will have both red and white wines along with light appetizers.

There will also be detailed written tasting notes and the opportunity to purchase similar wines at a special discount for our members.

If you're new to wine or a die hard fan, it's a great experience for all members. This is such a fun wine tasting that sells out every time!

*MUST PREPAY HERE  

*NO tickets sold at door. Prepay only event. 

FAQs:

How many will be attending? This is being co-organized by several Meetup groups. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. Based on pre-sales already, we will have at least 25+ members attending! 

Can I come alone? Yes about 90% will attend on their own. 

Do I need to know about wine? No, most come for socializing, learning and the enjoyment of wine.

What's dress code? Wear what you had on at work. It is a casual and comfortable atmosphere. 

What are the ages? This is non-age, non-ethnic specific event and is not meant to be gender balanced. We'll have a good mix of ages 20s-50s. Everyone always seems to find people in their peer group to hang and taste with. 

How much are tickets? Tickets start are just $35 (goes to $45 as event gets closer). 

Do I have to buy a ticket in advance? Yes. Space is limited and this will sell out. An RSVP alone will not hold your spot. You must purchase a ticket at this link to be confirmed - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wine414/dates/May-31-2016_at_0630PM

results.description:
Join us for an incredible private wine tasting with several other similar Meetup groups. Meet in a private wine cellar and taste wines from all over the world. We will have both red and white wines along with light appetizers.

There will also be detailed written tasting notes and the opportunity to purchase similar wines at a special discount for our members.

If you're new to wine or a die hard fan, it's a great experience for all members. This is such a fun wine tasting that sells out every time!

*MUST PREPAY HERE  

*NO tickets sold at door. Prepay only event. 

FAQs:

How many will be attending? This is being co-organized by several Meetup groups. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. Based on pre-sales already, we will have at least 25+ members attending! 

Can I come alone? Yes about 90% will attend on their own. 

Do I need to know about wine? No, most come for socializing, learning and the enjoyment of wine.

What's dress code? Wear what you had on at work. It is a casual and comfortable atmosphere. 

What are the ages? This is non-age, non-ethnic specific event and is not meant to be gender balanced. We'll have a good mix of ages 20s-50s. Everyone always seems to find people in their peer group to hang and taste with. 

How much are tickets? Tickets start are just $35 (goes to $45 as event gets closer). 

Do I have to buy a ticket in advance? Yes. Space is limited and this will sell out. An RSVP alone will not hold your spot. You must purchase a ticket at this link to be confirmed - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wine414/dates/May-31-2016_at_0630PM
results.name: Private Wine Tasting Meetup w/ Apps (Must Prepay)

Join us for an incredible private wine tasting with several other similar Meetup groups. Meet in a private wine cellar and taste wines from all over the world. We will have both red and white wines along with light appetizers.

There will also be detailed written tasting notes and the opportunity to purchase similar wines at a special discount for our members.

If you're new to wine or a die hard fan, it's a great experience for all members. This is such a fun wine tasting that sells out every time!

*MUST PREPAY HERE  

*NO tickets sold at door. Prepay only event. 

FAQs:

How many will be attending? This is being co-organized by several Meetup groups. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. Based on pre-sales already, we will have at least 25+ members attending! 

Can I come alone? Yes about 90% will attend on their own. 

Do I need to know about wine? No, most come for socializing, learning and the enjoyment of wine.

What's dress code? Wear what you had on at work. It is a casual and comfortable atmosphere. 

What are the ages? This is non-age, non-ethnic specific event and is not meant to be gender balanced. We'll have a good mix of ages 20s-50s. Everyone always seems to find people in their peer group to hang and taste with. 

How much are tickets? Tickets start are just $35 (goes to $45 as event gets closer). 

Do I have to buy a ticket in advance? Yes. Space is limited and this will sell out. An RSVP alone will not hold your spot. You must purchase a ticket at this link to be confirmed - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wine414/dates/May-31-2016_at_0630PM

results.description:
*** UPDATE  ***

We lost our original venue (Dumbo Startup Lab has ceased operations), so we will be meeting at the DUMBO KITCHEN at 108 Jay Street!

See you all there !

Dan

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Meet us on the last Tuesday of the Month to learn, discuss and practice  Business Model Generation (BMG), the Canvas, a little bit of Lean Startup and overall business common sense. This methodology is a simple way to get a high level view of your current or future business and understand how each part of it integrates and interacts with the others. We use the Canvas, a simple diagram, to map these parts and interactions.

While fairly simple, this methodology is a very powerful tool.

You can learn more about the book, methodology, author, and the Canvas :

>> here << 

See you all then !

Dan & Stephen.
results.how_to_find_us: Find us in the Meeting room on the left as you enter.
results.name: Free : Intro to BMG + Workshop!

results.description:
Our last social event was a big hit, so we've decided to host another one!

Your RSVP includes one beer, glass of wine or soda.

Bring: Your ID

Who: This event is open to all of the engineers in our group, and RSVP is required.

Agenda:

6:30 - 7:30 Drink tickets distributed

7:30 - 8:00 Feel free to arrive later than 7:30, but you will not get your free drink.

We're not giving a talk, just hanging out. Our hosts will help introduce you to others in the group, so don't be afraid to come solo.

Why:

We've had some excellent workshops/classes and connected with some wonderful teachers, mentors, and teachers. Now it's time to relax and mingle with some of these great folks!

Stop by, say hi and have a drink with us.

= = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = =

NY JavaScript expects all speakers and attendees to follow the JSConf Code of Conduct.

Due to limited seating, RSVPs for our events are $3-15. There are no refunds or transfers, unless an event is cancelled or rescheduled. Proceeds go to ScriptEd, a charity to increase code literacy among NYC youth at under-resourced schools.

If you would like to sponsor or speak at one of our events, please email us at [masked].

results.description:
Join us for a Real Estate Investor Networking Party! 

Whether you're new to the business of investing or a seasoned professional, our events are organized to help you connect. 

Attendees:  
Some of the people attending include, but are not limited to: 

Real Estate Investors:
Attorneys, Realtors, Brokers, Bankers, Mortgage Reps, Wholesalers, Cash Buyers, Hard Money Lenders, Rehabbers, Multi-Family Buyers, Hard & Private Money Lenders, Portfolio Managers, and so much more! 

Equity & Bond Investors: 
Stock, Day, Bond, Futures, Currency, Forex, and Options Trader, Hedge Fund & Private Equity Managers and so much more! 

Atmosphere:  
- The dress code is Business Casual.  
- We will provide name tags for everyone that attends. We ask that you put your name and industry on your name tag.  
- Make sure you bring enough business cards. 

Time is Precious:  
Event is from 6:30 PM to 8:30 PM. Please make an effort to come on time s everyone benefits but feel free to stay as long as you like.  

Admission:  
- FREE for the First 100 RSVP on Meetup 
- $10 Thereafter (No Exception!)

Drinks:  
- 2 drink norm, 1 drink min. Because the venue is turning away other business to allow us to host our event, all our networking events require a "2 drink norm, 1 drink minimum!"

******Since this is a drinking establishment, all attendees must be 21+.*********

Location(Venue Sponsor):

                                                  ******La Sala******
results.name: Queen's 1st Real Estate Investor Networking Party

results.description:
It's a multilingual happy hour! Join Argot for drinks and conversation in French & English. Grab some unlimited wine/beer, meet locals and internationals, expand your community in NYC, and learn to speak French/English like a local!


English speakers learning French meet French speakers learning English for casual conversation in both languages. Taking turns being the novice and the expert, you'll speak for 8 minutes in French, then 8 minutes in English, and repeat with other partners. Wine, beer, snacks, and table topics will be provided to ensure great and easy conversation!

Registration required here on our website!!!!!


$15 for adults 21 & over (beer & wine included)
$8 for students under 21
results.name: French/English Drinks & Conversation

results.description:
This will be a 4 mile run or so through the streets of Rutherford.  If you want a completely flat run, this run's not for you as there are gradual uphills and downhills throughout the run.

We will run rain or shine, hot or cold. If you RSVP "Yes", please do your best to be on time as we'll only wait a few minutes past 6:30 PM to get rolling. If you have questions, comments, or doubts, feel free to email me.  Looking forward to seeing you.
results.how_to_find_us: We will meet at the train station.  Look for us closer to the tracks.  Look for people in running clothes.
results.name: 4 Mile Run in Rutherford - meet at Rutherford Train Station

results.description:
Meet us on Tuesdays at the Harlem L Bar and Lounge for after-work Lessons and open Steppin'.. Sharp atmosphere, intimate lighting, cozy leather couches, great seating, and drinks.  If you love smooth and soulful R&B and relaxed, good people, come check out this new social and cultural set happening Uptown.


Harlem L Bar and Lounge

2131 Frederick Douglass Blvd. (at 115th St. & 8th Ave)

New York, NY 10026

Subway B, C to 116th; A to 125th; 2, 3 to 116th

Time: 6:30-9:30pm

Cost: $5

FREE Lesson for Beginners during first hour! Please come on time.

Happy Hour $5 drink specials until 7PM!

*Its the new home for steppin' Uptown!  We love to teach this dance to new people and beginners.  No partner is necessary.

See you on Tuesdays!

 *Special: Click RSVP so we begin to reflect actual attendance, and we will enter you each time for a drawing of a Free volume of our Steppers Music CDs or Free Class/ Admission!
results.name: Uptown Steppers Set-- The Harlem L Bar and Lounge

group.name: New York & New Jersey "Chicago Style" Steppers

results.description:
Step right up! Step right up! Come one, come all to TechYes' Bias (Un)Fair!

Are you aware of your unconscious biases? How can you reflect on your biases to create more self-awareness?

While we know it's worthwhile to address these questions, we understand that facing your cognitive and social biases can be intimidating. Luckily, you don't have to do it alone!

Join us for some fun, interactive group activities that will tackle these questions and more!

To accommodate our interactive group activities, we will be hosting the event at WorkBench. Same address as our previous meet-up, but this time on the 5th floor! 

Food and beverages will be served at 6:30pm! We will be starting promptly at 7:00pm.
results.name: TechYes! #3: Bias (Un)Fair!

group.name: Tech Yes! Diversity in Tech Meetup

results.description:
Do you dream of one day seeing the world? Of experiencing the heritage, stories, and cultures of far-off places? Of selling all your possessions and driving to Peru in a 1999 Subaru Legacy you bought for $500 cash on Craigslist?

Thankfully, there are less extreme options. On Tuesday, May 31st, come learn about izi.travel, an innovative app and hub where thousands of content providers create guides for millions of travelers. Izi.travel will be showing off their unique and easy-to-use platform, which hosts guides for museums and cultural attractions and must-see spots in cities around the world. For more information, find izi.travel on Twitter, Facebook, and Youtube. (Check out their Connected Cities video, as well as their handy guide for creating an audio tour!)


We’ll be in the front room at our favorite haunt, E’s Bar, starting at 6:30 pm. Grab a drink at the bar and join us for an evening of fun and provoked wanderlust. See you all there.

Send questions or concerns to Drew Radtke @radtkedrew, by email at [masked], and connect with me on LinkedIn!
results.how_to_find_us: Join us in the front room
results.name: #drinkingaboutmuseums #nyc with izi.travel!

group.name: Drinking About Museums New York City

results.description:
NYC is full of people looking for something different that challenges them. We don't want to live on a daily routine until we get old. 

This meet up is for those who are in the process of changing their mindset from an employee to an entrepreneur. We will educate ourselves with books by Robert Kiyosaki, John Maxwell , Eric Worre , Napoleon Hill, Randy Gage, etc. I will provide weekly trainings and challenges in the business world. 

Network and meet others who want to apply new ideas to their life. 

You can reach me at:

[masked]

results.description:
Please join us at a beautiful new location and time just one block from Union Square!

Ananda Mandala is a Chakra clearing meditation designed to raise Kundalini energy. This guided meditation involves vigorous (Pranayama) breathing techniques.

Diksha  is an energy transfer that works by activating Kundalini energy. This creates a gradual shift in consciousness, freeing you from the suffering created by the mind, balancing the body's natural healing energies and attuning the brain to higher levels of awareness. Diksha does not belong to any religion or belief. It is a universal energy that can be received by anyone.

ANANDA MANDALA to be followed by DIKSHA.

*Please arrive promptly at 6:45pm so as not to inconvenience other participants. If you arrive after the first process has started you will have to wait until it is completed to join.

$10 suggested
results.how_to_find_us: 4, 5, 6, N, Q, R and L trains to Union Square

results.description:
Looking for a thrilling new musical experience? Always wanted to perform and sing a capella style like Pitch Perfect or Glee? Do you miss singing with a group, competing and performing?

The award-winning Greater Nassau Chorus, a group of 65 diverse women of all ages and backgrounds, is auditioning female singers on all four voice parts. If you're passionate about singing, performing and competing, then we have a place for you! This powerhouse all female a capella chorus is fresh off a ninth place international finish in Las Vegas. 

No prior singing experience is necessary and the ability to read music is not a requirement. Even if you just sing in the car or the shower, if you can carry a tune, we can work with you! Every rehearsal is a masterclass in technique, vocal production and musicality. We are an organization committed to education on the barbershop craft. 

Classy, modern and elegant, this is barbershop for a new generation. At rehearsal you’ll be greeted by our Membership Co-Coordinators and walked through the audition process.

Wondering about the kind of music you'll be singing? Check out the videos below. We sing everything from traditional barbershop and standards to showtunes, pop and rock- we even did an entire show based on the music of Queen and Freddie Mercury!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n9vffXnGK_8

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gWg_vL0vrWE


We'd love to talk to you if you have any questions. Visit our website to find more information: www.greaternassauchorus.org

For more information regarding auditions and our rehearsals, please email: [masked].

We look forward to singing with you soon!

results.description:
Maximize your potential with Russian Martial Arts!

CONQUER THE FEAR of a violent encounter.

INCREASE YOUR STRIKING POWER and learn practical self defense methods that will work ANYTIME, ANYWHERE


Develop a STRONG, FLEXIBLE, MOBILE PHYSIQUE and MENTAL FOCUS that will carry over into every aspect of your life.


Learn all this and much, much more at NJ RMA Self Defense Group, the official Meetup Group of System of Combat NJ.  Start your SPRING with with Russian Martial Arts, your first class is FREE.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1tm6NW32NdI


Enjoy your first class for free and after that, it is only $10 per class with discounts available for pre-payment. No contract required! Classes are held at 7:00pm on Tuesday and Thursday evenings at the YMHA OF UNION on 501 Green Lane, Union, NJ 07083.

About Us

If you are interested in Systema, Reality Based Self Defense,  Martial Arts, Grappling, Street Defense, or Mobility and Body Awareness, this is the Meetup Group for you.  Men and women, seasoned martial artists and raw beginners alike will benefit from our dynamic classes which are tailored to the level and needs of the students. We focus on providing comprehensive instruction, plenty of personal attention and a relaxed atmosphere where you can train at your own pace and intensity. Individual classes are fast-paced and varied, ranging in subject from striking mechanics, grappling and ground fighting, evasive movement, weapon defense, sparring, and dealing with multiple attackers to women's self defense and street safety.
Copyright © 2013 System of Combat NJ                                   

About Systema

Systema is a combat style based on ancient Slavic fighting methods which were collected and codified by the Russian Soviet special forces.  It is a devastatingly effective and versatile combative program that can easily stand alone, or augment your existing practice.  The overarching focus is on responding to a threat spontaneously with natural, instinctive movement which strengthens and restores the body, clarifies the mind, and provides a framework for healthy, safe, life-long activity 

About the instructor 

Jim has over 25 years of martial arts experience in various styles including Brazilian Jiu-jitsu (BJJ), Silat, Boxing, Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) and Karate.  He is certified to teach Systema by Alex Wilkie (Alex Wilkie's Martial Arts Academy).

Directions

When you arrive, let the front desk know you are there for the martial arts class and they will direct you. (You do not have to be a Y-member to attend this class).  For general inquiries or more information, message organizers Jimi D or Drew here on the Meetup page.  If you need to reach the instructor, Jim, for any reason, call

Looking forward to training with you!

results.description:
Our Tuesday night Central Park training workouts are typically tempo runs or hill repeats.  These workouts are usually very well attended with a wide variety of paces.

The meeting spot is at the 72nd street transverse by Bethesda Fountain. There we'll give the full workout details, including distance, pacing groups, expected run time, and where we plan on meeting at the end. You can expect a typical workout to be between 5 and 8 miles (or less during hill workouts).

A note on warm ups: We do not do a full warm up as a group in Central Park, so we encourage you to show up at 7 p.m. having jogged an easy mile or two ahead of time.

If it's your first time meeting us, feel free to come a few minutes early with any questions.  There are many other groups who meet on 72nd St so look for the one with folks in Whippet singlets.

Please note that there is no place to store bags inside Central Park. Pack light, or store your bags at a nearby gym if you are a member. Another option is the New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center, which stays open until 9pm: http://www.therunningcompany.net/new-yorks-homepage
results.how_to_find_us: We meet on 72nd transverse at the point that overlooks Bethesda Fountain
results.name: Central Park Training Run

results.description:
There's more to information design than meets the eye. Sergio Peçanha, The New York Times’ international graphics coordinator, will discuss how he uses information design to explain complex subjects. He will also break down an example of how information design can have social impact and help build community through a project to expand the cycling network in Queens.

Agenda

7:00-7:30 pm: Check-in & light refreshments
7:30-8:30 pm: Talk with Q&A
8:30-9:00 pm: Mingle 

About the Speaker

Sergio Peçanha has been a graphics editor at The New York Times since 2008. In 2011, he became The Times’ international graphics coordinator, working on subjects like the Arab Spring, the wars in Syria and Gaza, and the nuclear talks with Iran. Before working at The Times, he was the graphics director of The Dallas Morning News and a designer at Globo.com. He is from Rio de Janeiro and has an odd sense of humor (for which he apologizes in advance).

About Our Event Partner

Ustwo is a global digital product studio launching products, services and companies that make a measurable difference to the world. Since their foundation in 2004, they’ve partnered with some of the world's leading brands and have grown to four studios around the world in New York, Malmö, London and Sydney.
results.name: Showing the Way: Information Design for the People

Join Marcos Salazar, career + life coach and Co-founder + Executive Director of Be Social Change, and Adam Wozney, Community Manager at Wix Lounge, on Tuesday, May 31st for a FREE workshop on Personal Branding with Purpose: Communicate Your Passions, Talents, and Impact for Career Success.

======================================

** OFFICIAL RSVP on Eventbrite. Register: http://bit.ly/BSCpb531**

=======================================


Developing a personal brand - creating your image and guiding your reputation - has never been more important. Whether you’re seeking to move up in your organization, looking for a new job, thinking about making a career change, launching a new business, wanting to attract new clients, or looking to scale your social impact, in today’s rapidly-changing, hyper competitive working world a strong and consistent personal brand is key to creating new opportunities for your career or business.

The truth is we all have a personal brand. It is how we are perceived by others - our friends, colleagues, and the public. It is what people think about when they hear our name and what people say about when we are not in the room. The key question we need to ask is: do we take charge of our personal brand or do we leave it up to chance?

Personal Branding with Purpose is not about learning how to "create" a personal brand. It's about learning how to live your personal brand by sharing your authentic self and communicating clearly the value you can provide others. Our passions, talents, and impact are unique gifts we can give to the world. By learning how to market these gifts through personal branding, you create not only career and business opportunities but also a greater capacity to make a difference in the lives of others and the planet.

======================================

** OFFICIAL RSVP on Eventbrite. Register: http://bit.ly/BSCpb531**

=======================================

* Doors open at 6:30 PM, workshop starts at 7:00 PM sharp *

WHAT YOU'LL LEARN

• An understanding of personal branding- how you can leverage it to create new career and business opportunities as well as scale your impact

• Gain greater clarity about your passions, values, purpose, and career goals that serve as a foundation for an authentic personal brand

• Define your Big Idea - what you stand for - and integrate it with your unique knowledge and experience to communicate your brand value

• Identify your niche, target audience and articulate how you can help solve problems they have

• Assess and strategically build your online identity and presence|

• Develop strategies for maintaining and adapting your personal brand in a world of constant change

WHO THIS CLASS IS FOR

• Professionals looking to create new career and business opportunities

• People seeking a new job or looking to make a career shift

• Entrepreneurs wanting to increase their own visibility to grow their businesses

• Creatives and service providers (consultants, coaches, agents, and speakers) wanting to attract new clients and business opportunities

• Students or recent grads looking to build a foundation for their future career path

INSTRUCTOR BIOS

https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/dPMORfsoT-skXzhCGXDz03AQ5I38N3d7Y_zCIWvJo5djoMDjHSPBhqF888uRxwFC1gnPjdhLjxbyoKp-TPdnpUpbHQ39TbaOAGXfyKRLDy8IfBXQYjJU4Il43OBrgREUCpA=s1600

Marcos Salazar (@marcossalazar) is a social entrepreneur, career + life coach,consultant, speaker, and community builder. His passion is working with professionals, entrepreneurs, and creatives to help them pursue work they are passionate about, build authentic personal brands, become financially successful, and create lives that make the world a better place. He does this through 1-on-1 coaching, nonprofit and businesses consulting, and on a larger scale as Co-founder + Executive Director of Be Social Change where he’s built the largest social impact community and professional development hub in New York City. Marcos earned a B.A. in Psychology from Amherst College as well as a Masters in Organizational Management and an Executive Leadership Coaching certificate from The George Washington University. Marcos is a board member of the Young Professionals Nonprofit Network and an American Express Leadership Academy Fellow. You can learn more about him at www.MarcosSalazar.com.   

https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/HD25gIEoxR8ARXSbtTZ_fSeOL7BaHYH78kCKHtWSdoGtnojLmn5pxSSLpxlmK5RsWpc-zC1dQCWYqX9CWGwr17VM5MBE0QQs5orLRU3vKn0HG5LLuSAP712g6YB3AQwJYuw=s1600

Adam Wozney manages small business partnerships and events at Wix.com. He works out of Wix’s Wix Lounge, a free co-working and event space for small businesses, creatives and various industry professionals.

He specializes in strategic partnerships, experiential marketing, and community management. He is also a freelance digital marketing expert and amatuer rock climber with a passion for civic engagement.

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds/credit: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund, please provide the Paypal Transaction ID: 18D76937M[masked]R No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W 77th street): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors, check for pictures. the door is closed but unlocked, report to our security and go to the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Help us to post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
HBO is a leader in digital programming with long history of loyal subscribers. Casper is a mattress company that revolutionized the sleep industry in 2013.


GET 50%-OFF TICKETS HERE WITH CODE 'MEETUP'

What do an original programming giant and mattress tech company have in common? From encouraging users to share HBO accounts to changing the way consumers purchase mattresses, they have both made great strides in customer experience innovation for their respective services. HBO and Casper listen to their customers and use tech improve their consumers' journey navigating through their services.


What did HBO do to stay relevant in the competitive original programming industry? How did Casper cut through in an old school industry that is dominated by monopolistic companies? What are some techniques they use to stay ahead of competitors? What can a large brand like HBO learn from Casper and vice versa?

On May 31st, StrategyChat invites Jason Mulderig (VP of Brand and Product Marketing at HBO) and Terri Rockovich (VP of Acquisition at Casper) to talk about ways to innovate customer experiences and stay relevant in highly competitive industries.

GET 50%-OFF TICKETS HERE WITH CODE 'MEETUP'

results.description:
Thanks to all who could make Tuesday's talk and reading - To Have, Give All to All (video below). We had a wonderful discussion with some new members. As always, we are happy to welcome all who would like to attend. Please RSVP before Tuesday, 5/31 to attend our next meeting.

https://youtu.be/9D57pdH6Joc

This week we'll look at the next Lesson of Love from Chapter 6 - To Have Peace, Teach Peace to Learn It. Here's an excerpt -


"To have peace, teach peace to learn it."


This is still a preliminary step, since having and being are still not equated. It is, however, more advanced than the first step, which is really only the beginning of the thought reversal. The second step is a positive affirmation of what you want. This, then, is a step in the direction out of conflict, since it means that alternatives have been considered, and one has been chosen as more desirable. Nevertheless, the term "more desirable" still implies that the desirable has degrees. Therefore, although this step is essential for the ultimate decision, it is clearly not the final one. Lack of order of difficulty in miracles has not yet been accepted, because nothing is difficult that is wholly desired. To desire wholly is to create, and creating cannot be difficult if God Himself created you as a creator.

We hope you'll join us this Tuesday to read and discuss this powerful and expansive idea. We are happy and honored by your participation.
results.name: ACIM - To Have Peace, Teach Peace to Learn It

Come play with us this summer!

Don't have a full team?  Bring a couple friends and we'll put you on the same team or sign up as a free agent and we'll put you on a team with other fun people in a similar skill level.

results.description:
Tech Tuesday is Hack Manhattan’s weekly general interest open house. Don’t worry, it’s not just about technology—any kind of project is welcome.

Tech Tuesday is the perfect opportunity to visit Hack Manhattan and check out what it’s all about.

Bring a project and get to work, use our tools, drink a homebrew beer, hang out, and draw on advice from our wonderful community. Visitors are strongly encouraged to bring a project to work on, or at least a laptop.

Find out more about Hack Manhattan at our website, hackmanhattan.com. Not everyone can come in every Tuesday, so most of the community happens on our mailing list.


If you want to join Hack Manhattan as a member, we expect you to have visited us at least thrice before applying.

Note: The last Tuesday of the month is our monthly business meeting. It usually lasts less than 30 minutes.

results.description:
Join us on May 31st for our next NJ Real Estate Connect meeting.   TWO hours of high-octane networking, deal-making, and masterminding to take your business to the next level!

Location:  Embassy Suites - 95 International Blvd, Elizabeth, NJ

REFRESHMENTS WILL BE SERVED!

TOPIC:  How to leverage Self-Directed IRAs to Fund your Real Estate Deals and Shelter from Taxes 

Speakers:  Karen Augis, Next Generation Trust Services

There is over $9 Trillion sitting in retirement accounts across the United States today.  It doesn't take even a half percent of that to fund all of your real estate deals for the rest of your investing career.  The #1 Critical Component of succeeding in the real estate business (outside of an undying determination and the industrious work ethic) is your ability to access capital.  Karen Augis from Next Generation Trust will be showing us how real estate investors can tap in to Self-Directed IRAs to fund their flips and to buy rental properties.  All the Do's, Dont's, and nitty-gritty of Self-Directed IRAs.  If you're a serious real estate investor, you won't want to miss this next meeting!

Entry Fee is $25.  Can be paid via Paypal or Credit Card at the Registration table.

AGENDA:

6:30pm -- Registration

7pm -- Greetings, Casual Networking, Refreshments

7:30 -- Speed Networking Train 

8:10 -- Keynote Presentation

9pm -- Event concludes.  Hang out and network.

***PLUS Don't Miss "Speed Networking Train" where you get to meet everyone in the room and exchange business cards!  This takes place at 7:30pm, so don't be late.  Bring tons of business cards with you and get ready to meet some amazing people doing deals right here in our backyard!
results.name: How to Tap in to this $9 Trillion Industry to Fund Your Real Estate Investments

Samuel Adams, Timo Andres, Matt Aucoin, Jean-Baptiste Barrière, Derek Bermel, Lisa Bielawa, Daníel Bjarnason, David Bruce, Chris Cerrone, Anthony Cheung, Bryce Dessner, Philip Glass, Michael Gordon, Mark Grey, John Harbison, Vijay Iyer, Gabriel Kahane, Phil Kline, David Lang, David Ludwig, James Matheson, Missy Mazzoli, Eric Nathan, Marc Neikrug, Christopher Rountree, Frederic Rzewski, Kaija Saariaho, Sean Shepherd, Noam Sivan, Augusta Read Thomas, Julia Wolfe.

results.description:
Note: I will not attend this event. The reservation is under my name, Fay Kambos. 


The Place: Jungsik offers a modern and unique Korean cuisine by innovative Chef Yim whom the New York Times has christened "The Pioneer of Modern Korean." This landmark Seoul experience is now offered at his TriBeCa flagship (former Chanterelle space), where bold flavors and playful culinary offerings abound. Jungsik brings the innovations of French cuisine and new Spanish movements into the Korean realm while staying true to big and bold familiar flavors of Korea.

http://jungsik.kr/#hello


RSVPs: Please do not RSVP No. You only need to RSVP if you want to come to the event. 

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I notice the people who RSVP and then cancel, which is not fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better, but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come. 

Even if the meetup is full, please put your name on the waitlist. I will let you know if a spot becomes available. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist, it lets me know which kind of restaurants are popular so that I may schedule more of those in the future. Thanks. 

Please note that meetup events are strictly for members. No +1s are allowed as reservations are made in advance and spots are assigned. First time members must confirm in writing that they will attend. Individuals that are no shows are immediately banned from the group. Thanks.
results.name: Jungsik - Two Michelin Stars

Margarita's for $7, Beer and Tequila Shot $7, Assorted Beers for $5 Tecate is $4

Below is their regular menu for their tacos which you get two of:

Again, the prices are up there but the food varieties are great and flavorful. You can go the taco route or pick some of their other great entrees as well. They have a great space and it's in my favorite area of the city. They also have a basement lounge to boot.

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:40 pm
Sun 1 – 2 pm (12 – 1 pm on 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles
results.how_to_find_us: CRS is located one block east of Broadway and one and a half blocks south of Union Square, above Think Coffee shop.
results.name: Walk-In Spiritual Healing Clinic

results.description:
Join Sal Becker on an exploration of Jobim, a Clojurescript presentation framework for creating slideshows and blogposts with testable code examples. Jobim takes advantage of Clojure's homoiconic nature to evaluate any code examples within your presentation, allowing you to write unit tests against them. After a basic tutorial, learn how a functional approach vastly improved the modularity and reusability of the library.


https://github.com/mysterymachine/jobim
